original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: purity of object and purity of view.

original: de dag ni yongs su dag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni yongs su dag pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two purities.

original: de'i shes rab de yang thams cad kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de yang thams cad kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: His wisdom is all-pervading,

original: sems can gyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: sems can gyi rjes su song ba /
translated: it pervades all beings,

original: chos kyi rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su song ba'o //
translated: and it pervades all things.

original: de'i shes rab de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyir mtshams sbyor ba'ang med la /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyir mtshams sbyor ba'ang med la /
translated: His wisdom does not create the conditions for any passions,

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad kyi mtshams kyang sbyor ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad kyi mtshams kyang sbyor ro //
translated: but it does create the conditions for all the stages of rebirth.

original: de'i shes rab de gnas pa yang med la /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de gnas pa yang med la /

original: yul thams cad dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la yang gnas so //
analyzed: yul thams cad dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la yang gnas so //
translated: but it is fixed on all objects and on the object of omniscience.

original: de'i shes rab de ni mtha' dang yang bral la /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de ni mtha' dang yang bral la /
translated: His wisdom is free from extremes

original: dbus la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: dbus la yang mi gnas so //
translated: and it does not dwell in the middle.

original: de'i shes rab de ni phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de'i shes rab de ni phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i spyod yul lo //

original: 'byung ba shin tu mthong ba'i phyir sgrib pa med pa yang rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba shin tu mthong ba'i phyir sgrib pa med pa yang rnyed pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the unobstructed because it sees the emergence.

original: de'i shes rab de ni chos thams cad shes shing mngon par rtogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i shes rab de ni chos thams cad shes shing mngon par rtogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //

original: de'i shes rab de ni chos kyi don thams cad dang ldan yang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i shes rab de ni chos kyi don thams cad dang ldan yang ldan pa yang ma yin /

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin /

analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin te / sbyor ba'am / mi sbyor ba'am /

original: @370b chos gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @370b chos gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be expressed by any dharma,üîΩwhether it is connected or not connected.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi 'byung gnas ni ye shes kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi 'byung gnas ni ye shes kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: the source of a bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom is the source of wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi 'byung gnas yin no; ;thos pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'byung gnas yin no; ;thos pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: It is the source of merit, the source of learning,

original: yon tan gyi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: the source of qualities,

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: the source of the Dharma,

original: gzungs dang spobs pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: the source of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ and eloquence,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: the source of the correct discriminations,

original: yon tan dang ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: and the source of all the supreme qualities and wisdoms.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the perfection of insight.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa 'di bstan pa na 'khor de'i nang nas lha dang mi'i srog chags nyi khri nyis stong bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa 'di bstan pa na 'khor de'i nang nas lha dang mi'i srog chags nyi khri nyis stong bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this pure conduct of the perfection of insight was taught, twenty-two thousand beings in the retinue gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob par gyur to //
translated: Eight thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: dge slong lnga brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Five hundred monks were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: lha'i bu khri ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa rnam par dag nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu khri ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa rnam par dag nas /
translated: Ten thousand gods attained the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.

original: de dag gi tshig 'di skad ces 'dzer to //
analyzed: de dag gi tshig 'di skad ces 'dzer to //
translated: They exclaimed:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba lags na /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sgo'i le'u 'di thos par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba lags na /
translated: Those sentient beings who hear this chapter on the Dharma gateway of the completely pure conduct of the perfection of wisdom will take up all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: @371a *// gang dag thos nas mos pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes smras so ////üîΩbam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: @371a *// gang dag thos nas mos pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes smras so //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: What need is there to mention those who, having heard it, have interest in it, uphold it, keep it, read it, teach it, and practice it correctly?‚Äù

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug na rin po che la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtsug na rin po che la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva great being Ratnashikhin:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô completely pure conduct of the factors of awakening?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas te /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, dwelling in the application of mindfulness to the body,

original: lus la rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
analyzed: lus la rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar 'jog go /
translated: establishes mindfulness in the body by means of the two kinds of investigation.

original: rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of investigation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the investigation of the body as unattractive and the investigation of the body as attractive.

original: de la mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the investigation of the body as unattractive?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩkye ma lus 'di ni mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / kye ma lus 'di ni mi gtsang ba ste /
translated: It is

original: btsog pas yongs su gang ba yun thung zhing byis pa 'drid pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: btsog pas yongs su gang ba yun thung zhing byis pa 'drid pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the thought: ‚ÄúAlas, this body is impure, filled with impure substances, short-lived, and deceptive to the ignorant.‚Äù This is the investigation of the body as unattractive.

original: de la sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the investigation of the body as attractive?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It isüîΩthe thought: ‚ÄúThe body is the abode of the Dharma, the abode of morality, the abode of concentration, the abode of wisdom, the abode of liberation, and the abode of the vision of awareness of liberation.‚Äù

original: gang lus mi gtsang ba grogs med pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
analyzed: gang lus mi gtsang ba grogs med pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
translated: ‚ÄúI will attain the body of the TathƒÅgata,

original: chos kyi sku /
analyzed: chos kyi sku /
translated: the body of the Dharma,

original: bsod nams kyi sku /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi sku /
translated: the body of merit,

original: ye shes kyi sku /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku /
translated: the body of wisdom,

original: rdo rje'i sku /üîΩmi shigs pa'i sku /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku / mi shigs pa'i sku /
translated: the vajra body,üîΩthe indestructible body,

original: zag @371b pa med pa'i sku /
analyzed: zag @371b pa med pa'i sku /
translated: the body free from defilements,

original: 'jig rten gsum las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku /
translated: the body that is superior to the three worlds,

original: gzugs mthong na sems can thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba'i sku thob par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs mthong na sems can thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba'i sku thob par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni sdug pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the body that satisfies all sentient beings when they see it.‚Äô

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gnyis su so sor rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô cultivation of the close placement of mindfulness that is associated with the discernment of two aspects.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa na chos gnyis yongs su sbyong ste /üîΩgnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa na chos gnyis yongs su sbyong ste / gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: when bodhisattvas cultivate the close placement of mindfulness that entails observing the body in the body, they purify two things.üîΩWhat are these two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //üîΩde la mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / rtag pa'i rnam pa'o // de la mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: the aspect of impermanence and the aspect of permanence.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aspect of impermanence?

original: kye ma lus 'di ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: kye ma lus 'di ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: It is the reflection that this body is impermanent,

original: ring por mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ring por mi gnas pa /
translated: that it does not last long,

original: tha mar 'chi ba yin par shes nas /
analyzed: tha mar 'chi ba yin par shes nas /
translated: and that it will finally die.

original: lus kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i 'tsho ba mi spyod cing snying po nyid len to //
analyzed: lus kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i 'tsho ba mi spyod cing snying po nyid len to //
translated: Having understood this, one does not live a life of indulgence for the sake of the body, but takes up the essence.

original: de snying po gsum yin te /
analyzed: de snying po gsum yin te /
translated: There are three essences:

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: lus kyi snying po dang / longs spyod kyi snying po dang / 'tsho ba'i snying po dang gsum mo //
analyzed: lus kyi snying po dang / longs spyod kyi snying po dang / 'tsho ba'i snying po dang gsum mo //
translated: The essence of the body, the essence of wealth, and the essence of life.

original: de lus mi rtag go snyam nas sems can thams cad kyi bran dang slob mar khas blangs te /
analyzed: de lus mi rtag go snyam nas sems can thams cad kyi bran dang slob mar khas blangs te /
translated: Thinking that the body is impermanent, one accepts being a servant and a disciple of all sentient beings.

original: ci bya'o cog la 'bad pa yin /
analyzed: ci bya'o cog la 'bad pa yin /
translated: One is diligent in whatever needs to be done.üîΩThinking that the body is impermanent, one does not engage in any of the body‚Äôs faults, such as crookedness, deceit, and hypocrisy.

original: lus mi rtag go snyam nas lus kyi nyes pa yon po dang / g-yo dang / tshul 'chos pa thams cad mi byed do; ;lus mi rtag go snyam nas srog la bag mi rton par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus mi rtag go snyam nas lus kyi nyes pa yon po dang / g-yo dang / tshul 'chos pa thams cad mi byed do; ;lus mi rtag go snyam nas srog la bag mi rton par 'gyur te /
translated: Thinking that the body is impermanent, one does not trust in life.

original: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa mi byed do //
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa mi byed do //
translated: For the sake of life itself, I will not commit evil.

original: lus mi rtag go snyam nas longs spyod la sred cing chags par mi byed de /üîΩbdog pa @372a *//
analyzed: lus mi rtag go snyam nas longs spyod la sred cing chags par mi byed de / bdog pa @372a *//
translated: Thinking that the body is impermanent, I will not crave or be attached to wealth.

original: thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin no //
translated: I will give away all my possessions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rtag pa'i rnam pas lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rtag pa'i rnam pas lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattvas, by means of the contemplation of impermanence, observe the body in the body and abide in it.

original: de las yon tan gyi phan yon rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: de las yon tan gyi phan yon rab tu thob bo //
translated: From this, they attain the benefits of the qualities.

original: de la rtag pa'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the contemplation of permanence?

original: gang lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi spyod pa'i ye shes skyes shing byung ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang / chos kyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang /
analyzed: gang lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi spyod pa'i ye shes skyes shing byung ba de dag sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang / chos kyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas who observe the body in the body and abide in it give rise to the wisdom of virtuous mental activity. They do not interrupt the lineage of the buddhas, the lineage of the Dharma, and the lineage of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rigs mi 'chad pa dang / sems can gyi khams mtha' dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: He dedicates to omniscience in order to protect the entire realm of sentient beings and to not cut off the lineage of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: sems can thams cad la btang ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la btang ba /
translated: He gives to all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He makes it common to all sentient beings. This is called the aspect of permanence.

original: gang mi zad pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang mi zad pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: What is imperishable is called permanent.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned is called imperishable.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is permanent.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsom pa thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'dus ma byas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rtsom pa thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'dus ma byas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva dedicates all the roots of virtue to the unconditioned omniscience. This is called the aspect of permanence.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are called permanent.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul dang / mtshan ma med pas nges par brtags pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pas brtson 'grus @372b brtsam pa thams cad rtsom pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul dang / mtshan ma med pas nges par brtags pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pas brtson 'grus @372b brtsam pa thams cad rtsom pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva‚Äôs practice of the domain of emptiness, his investigation with the signless, and his exertion with the wishless‚Äîall his exertion in practice‚Äîis called the aspect of permanence.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Space is called permanent.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems rnam par mi rtog pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems rnam par mi rtog pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'di ni rtag pa'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva‚Äôs practice with a nonconceptual mind equal to space is called the aspect of permanence.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa /üîΩbdag gi lus de sems can thams cad kyi lus nye bar 'dogs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa / bdag gi lus de sems can thams cad kyi lus nye bar 'dogs shing /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva cultivates the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the body,üîΩpositing his own body as the body of all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gnas la gnas par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gnas la gnas par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄòI will establish the bodies of all sentient beings in the state of the body of the Buddha.‚Äô

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zag pa med pa ltar rang gi lus kyi chos nyid la yang de bzhin du rtog go /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zag pa med pa ltar rang gi lus kyi chos nyid la yang de bzhin du rtog go /
translated: Just as the body of the Tathagata is undefiled, so also is the reality nature of his body.

original: de zag pa med pa'i chos la mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi lus kyang de'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i chos la mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi lus kyang de'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes so //
translated: By means of his skill in the undefiled Dharma, he knows the bodies of all sentient beings to have the same nature.

original: de zag pa med pa'i chos thob pas zag pa las 'byung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i chos thob pas zag pa las 'byung bar mi byed do //
translated: Having attained the undefiled Dharma, he does not cause the arising of the defilements.

original: zag pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the defilements?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa'o //
translated: the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, the defilement of ignorance, and the defilement of views.

original: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
translated: By means of his knowledge of the defilement of desire, he intentionally takes birth in the desire realm in order to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: srid pa'i zag pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: By means of his knowledge of the defilement of existence, he intentionally takes up existence in order to accumulate the roots of virtue.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa de gnyis rtsa ba nas 'don @373a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa de gnyis rtsa ba nas 'don @373a *//
translated: The defilement of ignorance and the defilement of views are completely removed.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor la 'jug go /
analyzed: pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor la 'jug go /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the defilements of ignorance and the defilements of views, bodhisattvas engage in yoga.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa de lus la sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang ma byung bar so sor rtog go /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa de lus la sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang ma byung bar so sor rtog go /
translated: When bodhisattvas cultivate the close placement of mindfulness that observes the body, they discern that the body does not come from the past.

original: lus la phyi ma'i mthar yang mi 'pho bar so sor rtog go /
analyzed: lus la phyi ma'i mthar yang mi 'pho bar so sor rtog go /
translated: They discern that the body will not go to the future.

original: lus la da ltar byung ba na rang bzhin gyis dben par yang so sor rtog go /
analyzed: lus la da ltar byung ba na rang bzhin gyis dben par yang so sor rtog go /
translated: They discern that the body is naturally void in the present.

original: de de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas las dang ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas las dang ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi bskyed do //
translated: In this way, when bodhisattvas abide in observing the body, they do not give rise to the view of the transitory collection that is associated with action.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral bas bdag gir mi byed do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bral bas bdag gir mi byed do //
translated: Free from the view of the transitory collection, they do not grasp at ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag gir byed pa med pas yongs su 'dzin pa la yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: bdag gir byed pa med pas yongs su 'dzin pa la yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: Since they do not grasp at ‚Äúmine,‚Äù they do not grasp at possessions.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med pa rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pas rtsod pa med pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: Since they do not grasp at possessions, they attain the absence of conflict.

original: rtsod pa spangs pas gnod sems med do; ;gnod sems med pas bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: rtsod pa spangs pas gnod sems med do; ;gnod sems med pas bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: By being free from malice, one attains patience.

original: bzod pa rab tu thob pas phyir khengs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bzod pa rab tu thob pas phyir khengs par mi 'gyur /
translated: By attaining patience, one does not become arrogant.

original: 'dud par yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩkhengs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dud par yang mi 'gyur ro // khengs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Nor does one become humble.

original: 'dud par yang mi 'gyur bas chos nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dud par yang mi 'gyur bas chos nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By not becoming arrogant or humble, one abides by the truth.

original: chos nyid la gnas pas phyir yang chos ma yin pa spyod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩchos spyod pas chos dang ldan pa'i 'gros su song ngo //
analyzed: chos nyid la gnas pas phyir yang chos ma yin pa spyod par mi 'gyur ro // chos spyod pas chos dang ldan pa'i 'gros su song ngo //
translated: By abiding by the truth, one does not engage in unrighteous conduct.üîΩBy engaging in righteous conduct, one proceeds with a righteous gait.

original: chos kyi 'gros su song bas chos dang ldan pa'i grogs po rab tu rnyed do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'gros su song bas chos dang ldan pa'i grogs po rab tu rnyed do //
translated: By proceeding with a righteous gait, one finds righteous friends.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i grogs pos yongs su bzung bas chos dang ldan pa'i mnyan @373b pa thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i grogs pos yongs su bzung bas chos dang ldan pa'i mnyan @373b pa thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being sustained by righteous friends, one hears the Dharma.

original: chos thos pa dang ldan pas phyir yang yul rnams la zag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thos pa dang ldan pas phyir yang yul rnams la zag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By being endowed with the hearing of the Dharma, one does not become defiled by objects.

original: yul la bsrungs pas ting nge 'dzin sgrub bo //
analyzed: yul la bsrungs pas ting nge 'dzin sgrub bo //
translated: By guarding against objects, one accomplishes samƒÅdhi.

original: mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Through meditative equipoise, one will know reality just as it is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tu rab tu shes pas phyir yang rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tu rab tu shes pas phyir yang rtog par mi byed do //
translated: By knowing reality just as it is, one will not engage in conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: One will not engage in conceptual proliferation.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas mi 'gyur ro; ;mi 'gyur bas phyir yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas mi 'gyur ro; ;mi 'gyur bas phyir yang mi byed do //
translated: By being free from conceptual proliferation, one will not change. By not changing, one will not engage in action.

original: rnam par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi byed do //
translated: One will not engage in conceptual proliferation.

original: nam mi byed /
analyzed: nam mi byed /
translated: When one does not engage in action,

original: rnam par mi byed pa de ni chos mnyam pa nyid kyis chos ji lta ba bzhin thob nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi byed pa de ni chos mnyam pa nyid kyis chos ji lta ba bzhin thob nas /
translated: and does not engage in conceptual proliferation, then, through the sameness of phenomena, one will attain the Dharma just as it is.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa 'di ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa 'di ni /
translated: This is the attainment of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the application of mindfulness that observes the body in terms of the body.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the application of mindfulness that observes feelings in terms of feelings?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas‚Äô cultivation of the application of mindfulness that observes feelings with regard to feelings

original: tshor ba la bde bar gnas pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la bde bar gnas pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the attainment of great compassion for those sentient beings who are attached to the experience of feelings.

original: de 'di ltar gang la tshor ba med pa de ni bde ba yin no zhes slob ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar gang la tshor ba med pa de ni bde ba yin no zhes slob ste /
translated: They train in the thought, ‚ÄòThat which is devoid of feelings is happiness.‚Äô

original: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba spong ba'i phyir tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom mo //üîΩde sems can rnams kyi tshor ba @374a *//
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba spong ba'i phyir tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom mo // de sems can rnams kyi tshor ba @374a *//
translated: They cultivate the application of mindfulness that observes feelings with regard to feelings in order to eliminate the feelings of all sentient beings.üîΩThey don the armor for the sake of stopping the feelings of sentient beings,

original: 'gog pa'i phyir go cha bgos kyang bdag gi tshor ba yang 'gog par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir go cha bgos kyang bdag gi tshor ba yang 'gog par mi byed do //
translated: but they do not stop their own feelings.

original: des tshor ba gang ci myong yang tshor ba de dag thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung zhing myong bar byed do //
analyzed: des tshor ba gang ci myong yang tshor ba de dag thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung zhing myong bar byed do //
translated: Whatever feelings they experience, they experience them all with great compassion, embracing them all.

original: de nam bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de na 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
analyzed: de nam bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba de na 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
translated: When he experiences a pleasant feeling, he finds great compassion for those sentient beings who are attached to pleasure.

original: bdag gi 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo //
translated: He also eliminates the latent tendency to desire.

original: nam sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba de na zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
analyzed: nam sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba de na zhe sdang la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
translated: When he experiences a painful feeling, he finds great compassion for those sentient beings who are attached to anger.

original: bdag gi zhe sdang gi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo //üîΩnam bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag gi zhe sdang gi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo // nam bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He also eliminates the latent tendency to anger.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba de ni gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba de ni gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rnyed de /
translated: When he experiences a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful, he finds great compassion for those sentient beings who are attached to delusion.

original: bdag gi gti mug gi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi gti mug gi bag la nyal yang rab tu spong ngo //
translated: He also eliminates the latent tendency to delusion.

original: de bde ba'i tshor ba la rjes su chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bde ba'i tshor ba la rjes su chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become attached to pleasant feelings.

original: rjes su chags pa legs par 'joms par yang byed do //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa legs par 'joms par yang byed do //
translated: He also destroys attachment.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la khong khro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become angry at painful feelings.

original: khong khro ba legs par 'joms par byed do //üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: khong khro ba legs par 'joms par byed do // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: He conquers anger well.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ma rig pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ma rig pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become ignorant about neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings.

original: ma rig pa legs par 'joms par yang byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa legs par 'joms par yang byed do //
translated: He conquers ignorance well.

original: des tshor ba gang ci myong yang de dag thams cad kyang mi rtag par shes shing myong bar byed do //
analyzed: des tshor ba gang ci myong yang de dag thams cad kyang mi rtag par shes shing myong bar byed do //
translated: Whatever feelings he experiences, he experiences them all as impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal du shes shing myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du shes shing myong bar byed do //
translated: He experiences them as suffering.

original: de bde ba'i tshor ba la ni mi @374b rtag par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bde ba'i tshor ba la ni mi @374b rtag par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences pleasant feelings as impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zug rngur shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zug rngur shes par 'gyur ro // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: He experiences painful feelings as a dart.üîΩHe experiences neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings as peaceful.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni zhi bar shes par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar na gang bde ba de ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la ni zhi bar shes par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar na gang bde ba de ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Thus, whatever is pleasant is impermanent.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: Whatever is painful is suffering.

original: gang bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not happiness.üîΩ

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: That which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is selfless.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de chos thams cad skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang / zhu ba dang / gnas pa med par shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de chos thams cad skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang / zhu ba dang / gnas pa med par shes so //
translated: the bodhisattva who thus observes feelings and abides in the observation of feelings knows that all phenomena are unborn, unceased, unagitated, and unceasing.

original: chos thams cad la skye ba dang / 'jig par yang so sor rtog go /üîΩso sor rtog pa na chos skye ba de dag gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: chos thams cad la skye ba dang / 'jig par yang so sor rtog go / so sor rtog pa na chos skye ba de dag gang nas 'ongs /
translated: He also discerns the arising and cessation of all phenomena.üîΩWhen he discerns them, he does not see the arising and cessation of phenomena, thinking, ‚ÄòWhere do those phenomena that arise come from?

original: 'gag pa rnams gang du gsog par 'gyur snyam du chos rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //üîΩdes chos rnams gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: 'gag pa rnams gang du gsog par 'gyur snyam du chos rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // des chos rnams gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Where do those that cease accumulate?‚Äô

original: gang du yang mi 'gro bar shes nas tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro bar shes nas tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad par bsgrub bo //
translated: Knowing that phenomena do not come from anywhere and do not go anywhere, he establishes the cessation of all feelings.

original: bsgrubs nas kyang nan tan du mi byed do //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas kyang nan tan du mi byed do //
translated: Having established it, he does not practice it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba 'gag par byed kyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba 'gag par byed kyi /
translated: I will put an end to the feelings of all sentient beings,

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gi tshor ba 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gi tshor ba 'gag par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not just my own feelings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa thabs mkhas pa dang snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa thabs mkhas pa dang snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô close placement of mindfulness that observes feelings, which is supported by skillful means and great compassion.

original: gang tshor ba 'gag pa yang rab tu @375a *//
analyzed: gang tshor ba 'gag pa yang rab tu @375a *//
translated: ‚ÄúThey know the cessation of feelings,

original: shes la / tshor ba 'gag pa mngon sum du yang mi byed de /
analyzed: shes la / tshor ba 'gag pa mngon sum du yang mi byed de /
translated: but they do not actualize the cessation of feelings.

original: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa la gnas pa de tshor ba rnams dben pa dang / rnam par dben par yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa la gnas pa de tshor ba rnams dben pa dang / rnam par dben par yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They remain in the cultivation of the close placement of mindfulness that observes feelings, and they know feelings as they are‚Äîas isolated and solitary.

original: 'di la ni myong ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni myong ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing to be experienced here.

original: 'di la ni tshor bar byed pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni tshor bar byed pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing to be felt here.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni stong pa ste /
translated: All these things are empty.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: It is not endowed with an agent or a feeler.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on causes and conditions.

original: bdag po med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa'o //
translated: It is without a master.

original: nga yi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: nga yi ba med pa'o //
translated: It is without ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without grasping.

original: des yang dag par rgyu dang rkyen de dag gi dngos po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: des yang dag par rgyu dang rkyen de dag gi dngos po mi dmigs so //
translated: It does not apprehend the entities of those causes and conditions.

original: des ma dmigs nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des ma dmigs nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When it does not apprehend them, it thinks,üîΩ‚ÄòJust as conditions are empty, so the phenomena that arise from conditions are also empty.‚Äô

original: ji ltar rkyen stong pa yin pa de bzhin du rkyen las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang stong pa'o snyam nas de stong pa nyid kyi don rig pas lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / don shes pa dang / chos rnams shes pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar rkyen stong pa yin pa de bzhin du rkyen las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang stong pa'o snyam nas de stong pa nyid kyi don rig pas lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / don shes pa dang / chos rnams shes pa dang /
translated: ‚Äú ‚ÄòBy knowing the meaning of emptiness, the body is isolated, the mind is isolated, the meaning is known, phenomena are known,

original: ye shes rig pas tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rig pas tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bsgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas‚Äô meditation on the application of mindfulness that observes feelings with the knowledge of pristine awareness is the pure practice of the application of mindfulness that observes feelings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag @375b pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag @375b pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure practice of the application of mindfulness that observes the mind with regard to the mind?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pas gnas pa byang chub kyi sems dran pa nye bar bzhag pa shin tu nye bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pas gnas pa byang chub kyi sems dran pa nye bar bzhag pa shin tu nye bar bzhag ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas‚Äô practice of the application of mindfulness that observes the mind with regard to the mind is the application of mindfulness that is well established in the mind of awakening.

original: sems dran pa ye shes kyis sems kun tu tshol lo //
analyzed: sems dran pa ye shes kyis sems kun tu tshol lo //
translated: With the knowledge of pristine awareness, they seek the mind with the mindfulness of the mind.

original: de sems kun du tshol ba na sems nang na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de sems kun du tshol ba na sems nang na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: When they seek the mind, they do not see the mind existing internally,

original: sems phyi rol na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sems phyi rol na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the mind as external.

original: sems phyi dang nang na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sems phyi dang nang na yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the mind as both external and internal.

original: phung po rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /üîΩkhams rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: phung po rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / khams rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the mind in the aggregates.üîΩHe does not see the mind in the elements.

original: skye mched rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la yang sems yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the mind in the sense bases.

original: des sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas sems ga las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun tu tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des sems yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas sems ga las byung zhes sems kyi rgyun kun tu tshol zhing de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Since he does not see the mind, he searches for the origin of the mind. He thinks,

original: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa las sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: ‚ÄòThe mind arises from an object.‚Äô

original: de yang 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du sems te / ci dmigs pa de yang gzhan la /
translated: He thinks,

original: sems de yang gzhan nam /
analyzed: sems de yang gzhan nam /
translated: ‚ÄòIs the object one thing and the mind another?

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin /üîΩgal te dmigs pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin / gal te dmigs pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Or is the object itself the mind?

original: sems kyang gzhan yin na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyang gzhan yin na ni sems de gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is one thing and the mind another, then there are two minds.

original: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems yin na ni /
translated: If, on the other hand, the object of observation is the mind itself,

original: sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyis sems de ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could the mind see that mind?

original: sems kyis sems mthong bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mthong bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for the mind to see the mind.

original: 'di @376a *// lta ste /
analyzed: 'di @376a *// lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid gcad par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du sems de nyid kyis kyang sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so snyam nas /
analyzed: dper na / ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid gcad par mi nus pa dang / sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid kyis sor mo'i rtse mo de nyid la reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du sems de nyid kyis kyang sems de nyid mthong bar mi nus so snyam nas /
translated: just as the edge of a sword cannot cut the edge of that same sword, and just as the tip of a finger cannot touch the tip of that same finger, in the same way, the mind itself cannot see the mind itself.

original: de 'di ltar tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba la gang sems mi gnas pa /
analyzed: de 'di ltar tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba la gang sems mi gnas pa /
translated: ‚Äú In this way, when one is correctly engaged, the mind does not abide,

original: chad pa ma yin pa; rtag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa; rtag pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not annihilated, it is not permanent,

original: ther zug tu mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ther zug tu mi gnas pa /
translated: it does not abide eternally,

original: rgyu med pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not causeless,

original: rkyen dang mi 'gal ba /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi 'gal ba /
translated: it is not contradictory to conditions,

original: de las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de las kyang ma yin /
translated: it is not from itself,

original: gzhan las kyang ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ma yin pa /
translated: it is not from another,üîΩit is not from both,

original: de nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: and it is not without a cause.

original: gzhan yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyud /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyud /
translated: The continuum of the mind

original: sems kyi 'khri shing /
analyzed: sems kyi 'khri shing /
translated: The creeper of the mind

original: sems kyi chos nyid /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid /
translated: The nature of the mind

original: sems mi gnas pa dang / sems rgyu ba med pa dang / sems snang ba med pa dang / sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar de bzhin nyid du 'khrug par mi byed pa de ltar shes so //
analyzed: sems mi gnas pa dang / sems rgyu ba med pa dang / sems snang ba med pa dang / sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar de bzhin nyid du 'khrug par mi byed pa de ltar shes so //
translated: The mind is not still, the mind does not move, the mind does not appear, and the mind‚Äôs own characteristic is not disturbed in suchness.

original: de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: In that way, it is seen.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du sems de dag dben pa nyid du rab tu shes /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du sems de dag dben pa nyid du rab tu shes /
translated: Just as suchness is, so too the mind is known to be isolated.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba de na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba de na /
translated: In that way, it is seen.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct in the application of mindfulness that observes the mind with regard to the mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang sems la cung zad tsam yang mi mthong /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems la cung zad tsam yang mi mthong /
translated: furthermore, the mind is not seen in the slightest way.

original: rnam par mi mthong /üîΩmi rtog / rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi mthong / mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog /
translated: It is not seen,üîΩit is not conceptualized, and it is not thought.

original: g-yo med / rlom sems med /
analyzed: g-yo med / rlom sems med /
translated: It is without movement and without conceit.

original: spros pa med pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran @376b pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran @376b pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This absence of conceptual elaboration is the bodhisattva‚Äôs application of mindfulness that observes the mind in relation to the mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble sir,

original: gzhan yang ji ltar sems gzugs med pa de bzhin du sems kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar sems gzugs med pa de bzhin du sems kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: just as the mind is formless, so also are the wholesome roots that are created by the mind.

original: ji ltar sems kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gzugs med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gzugs med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the wholesome roots that are created by the mind are formless,

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngos pa yang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngos pa yang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: so also is the dedication of the thought of awakening.üîΩJust as the dedication of the thought of awakening is formless,

original: ji ltar byang chub kyi sems su bsngos pa gzugs med pa de bzhin du byang chub de yang gzugs med de /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub kyi sems su bsngos pa gzugs med pa de bzhin du byang chub de yang gzugs med de /
translated: so also is awakening.

original: de'i phyir sems ji lta bar spyod pa yang de bzhin no //üîΩspyod pa ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ji lta bar spyod pa yang de bzhin no // spyod pa ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, just as is the mind, so also is the practice.üîΩJust as is the practice, so also is awakening.

original: byang chub ji lta bar yongs su bsngo ba yang de bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bar yongs su bsngo ba yang de bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as is awakening, so also is the dedication.‚Äù

original: sems kyi rang bzhin ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin ni byang chub bo //
translated: The nature of mind is awakening.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin ni chos thams cad de /
translated: The nature of awakening is all phenomena.

original: gang 'di ltar sems rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar sems rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that discerns the mind in this way is the bodhisattvas‚Äô close placement of mindfulness that observes the mind in the mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang gang mgyogs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang mgyogs pa /
translated: furthermore, the mind is swift,

original: rab tu mgyogs pa /
analyzed: rab tu mgyogs pa /
translated: very swift,

original: mi gnas par rgyu ba; spre'u dang / rlung 'dra ba /
analyzed: mi gnas par rgyu ba; spre'u dang / rlung 'dra ba /
translated: moving without abiding, like a monkey or the wind,

original: 'bab chu'i rgyun dang / 'bru mar gyi mar me dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'bab chu'i rgyun dang / 'bru mar gyi mar me dang 'dra ba /
translated: like a waterfall or a candle flame,

original: rgyang ring por 'gro ba /
analyzed: rgyang ring por 'gro ba /
translated: going far,

original: lus med pa /
analyzed: lus med pa /
translated: without a body,

original: yul la brkam pa /
analyzed: yul la brkam pa /
translated: craving objects,

original: skye mched drug la spyod yul ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug la spyod yul ba /
translated: the domain of the six sense sources,üîΩendowed with the knowledge of one thing after another,

original: gzhan dang gzhan gyi shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems gnas pa /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan gyi shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems gnas pa /
translated: the mind that abides,

original: rtse gcig pa /üîΩmi 'phro ba /
analyzed: rtse gcig pa / mi 'phro ba /
translated: one-pointed,üîΩnot proliferating,

original: rnam par mi 'phro ba /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'phro ba /
translated: not proliferating at all,

original: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa /
analyzed: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa /
translated: one-pointed in ≈õamatha,

original: g-yeng ba med pa 'di ni sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba med pa 'di ni sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and undistracted. This is called ‚Äòthe mind abiding.‚Äô

original: de la @377a *//
analyzed: de la @377a *//
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yongs su rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yongs su rdzogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete application of mindfulness?

original: sems la rnam par 'byed par shes pa dang / sems la chos kyi dbyings su gnas par shes pa dang / sems la sems gnas par shes pa dang / sems la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar shes pa dang / sems la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems la rnam par 'byed par shes pa dang / sems la chos kyi dbyings su gnas par shes pa dang / sems la sems gnas par shes pa dang / sems la rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar shes pa dang / sems la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the mind as it really is, the knowledge of the mind as the realm of Dharma, the knowledge of the mind as the abode of the mind, the knowledge of the mind as naturally luminous, the knowledge of the mind as it really is,

original: sems la mngon sum gyi shes pas rab tu shes pa dang / sems la sgyu ma'i chos su shes pa dang / sems la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / sems la de kho nar shes pa dang / sems la g-yo ba med cing gzung ba med par shes pa 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems la mngon sum gyi shes pas rab tu shes pa dang / sems la sgyu ma'i chos su shes pa dang / sems la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / sems la de kho nar shes pa dang / sems la g-yo ba med cing gzung ba med par shes pa 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of the mind by direct perception, the knowledge of the mind as the Dharma of illusion, the knowledge of the mind as the equality of the three times, the knowledge of the mind as suchness, and the knowledge of the mind as unmoving and ungraspable.

original: de rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yang de yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yang de yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that the nature of his own mind is the nature of the minds of all beings.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin de yongs su shes nas de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin de yongs su shes nas de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having fully understood the nature of mind, they teach the Dharma accordingly.

original: rang gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They fully understand that the nature of mind of all sentient beings is the same as the nature of their own mind.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having understood the nature of mind, they teach the Dharma accordingly.

original: rang gi sems kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They fully understand that the characteristics of the mental activity of all sentient beings are the same as the characteristics of their own mind.

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid de shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid de shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having understood the characteristics of mind, they teach the Dharma accordingly.

original: ji ltar @377b rang gi sems stong pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang stong par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar @377b rang gi sems stong pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang stong par rab tu shes so //
translated: They fully understand that just as their own mind is empty, the minds of all sentient beings are also empty.

original: sems de dag stong pa nyid du shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems de dag stong pa nyid du shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having understood that those minds are empty, they teach the Dharma accordingly.

original: de rang gi sems yang dag par 'du ba gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems yang dag par 'du ba yang de yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de rang gi sems yang dag par 'du ba gang yin pa sems can thams cad kyi sems yang dag par 'du ba yang de yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that the correct mental focus of all sentient beings is the same as his own correct mental focus.

original: sems yang dag par 'du ba de dag shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: sems yang dag par 'du ba de dag shes nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Knowing the correct mental focus of all sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: de rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de rang gi sems mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the sameness of the mind of all sentient beings through the sameness of his own mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the sameness of all phenomena through the sameness of the mind of all sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis byang chub mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis byang chub mnyam pa nyid du rab tu shes shing /
translated: He knows the sameness of awakening through the sameness of all phenomena.

original: sems kyis 'gyur bar mi byed de rnam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyis 'gyur bar mi byed de rnam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not change his mind, nor does he transform it.

original: sems gnas pas chos kyi dbyings gnas par rjes su shes kyang /
analyzed: sems gnas pas chos kyi dbyings gnas par rjes su shes kyang /
translated: He knows that the realm of phenomena is stable through the stability of mind.

original: sems gnas pa'i chos nyid de las kyang mi g-yo ste /
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i chos nyid de las kyang mi g-yo ste /
translated: He does not waver from the true nature of the stability of mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva‚Äôs pure practice of the application of mindfulness that observes the mind with regard to the mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattva‚Äôs pure practice of the application of mindfulness that observes phenomena with regard to phenomena?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: the bodhisattva who abides in the application of mindfulness that observes phenomena with regard to phenomena thinks as follows:

original: chos kho na @378a *//
analyzed: chos kho na @378a *//
translated: ‚ÄòIt is only phenomena

original: skye ba rnams skye /
analyzed: skye ba rnams skye /
translated: that arise when they are produced.

original: chos kho na 'gag pa rnams 'gag ste /
analyzed: chos kho na 'gag pa rnams 'gag ste /
translated: It is only phenomena that cease when they cease.

original: 'di la bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam /
translated: Here there is no self,

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: no sentient being,

original: srog gam / skye ba po'am /üîΩgso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
analyzed: srog gam / skye ba po'am / gso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
translated: no life force, no person,

original: gang zag gam /üîΩshed las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag gam / shed las skyes pa'am /
translated: no human,üîΩno human being,

original: shed bu'am / gang skye ba'am /
analyzed: shed bu'am / gang skye ba'am /
translated: no one born,

original: rga ba'am / 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: rga ba'am / 'chi ba'am /
translated: no one who ages, no one who dies,

original: 'pho ba'am / skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'pho ba'am / skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
translated: no one who passes on and is reborn.

original: 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of phenomena.

original: gal te bsgrubs na ni 'grub /
analyzed: gal te bsgrubs na ni 'grub /
translated: If you practice, you will accomplish it.

original: gal te ma bsgrubs na ni mi 'grub ste /üîΩdge ba yang rung /
analyzed: gal te ma bsgrubs na ni mi 'grub ste / dge ba yang rung /
translated: If you do not practice, you will not accomplish it.üîΩWhether it is virtuous,

original: mi dge ba yang rung /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang rung /
translated: nonvirtuous,

original: mi g-yo ba yang rung /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yang rung /
translated: or neutral,

original: ji lta bur bsgrubs pa de lta bur 'grub mod kyi /üîΩchos rnams la sgrub par byed pa yang med la /
analyzed: ji lta bur bsgrubs pa de lta bur 'grub mod kyi / chos rnams la sgrub par byed pa yang med la /
translated: you will accomplish it exactly as you practice.üîΩHowever, phenomena are not created,üîΩand without a cause, nothing arises.

original: chos rnams rgyu ba med par yang gang gis kyang mi skye'o snyam du nye bar brtags na /
analyzed: chos rnams rgyu ba med par yang gang gis kyang mi skye'o snyam du nye bar brtags na /
translated: When you examine this,

original: 'di ltar chos dran pa'i ye shes skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dran pa'i ye shes skye ste /
translated: the wisdom of mindfulness of phenomena arises.

original: gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang gsum mo //
translated: There are three types of creation of merit, nonvirtue, and neutrality.

original: de la bdag gis ni bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gis ni bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Among them, I will strive to create merit.

original: 'di ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa /
translated: This is the cause of my unsurpassed,üîΩsupreme,

original: mchog / dam pa /
analyzed: mchog / dam pa /
translated: excellent,

original: rab / khyad par du 'phags pa bcu'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab / khyad par du 'phags pa bcu'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: and special ten qualities of a buddha.

original: bcu po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩBy means of the purity of body, the major and minor marks, the invisible crown protrusion, and the complete transcendence of all harm from others,

original: lus yongs su dag pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba dang / pha rol gyi gnod pa byas pa thams cad las @378b shin tu 'das pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba dang / pha rol gyi gnod pa byas pa thams cad las @378b shin tu 'das pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa /
translated: by means of the purity of speech, the speech of the tathagatas that satisfies all sentient beings,

original: rnam pa drug cu shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sems yongs su dag pas sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa drug cu shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sems yongs su dag pas sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med cing /
translated: and by means of the purity of mind, the absence of anger toward all sentient beings,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrugs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su dag pas don dang / chos dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa mi zad pa dang / byams pa chen po yongs su dag pas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la rab tu 'god pa dang /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrugs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yongs su dag pas don dang / chos dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa mi zad pa dang / byams pa chen po yongs su dag pas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la rab tu 'god pa dang /
translated: the uninterrupted and unshakable meditative concentration, and by means of the purity of the analytical knowledges, the inexhaustibility of meaning, Dharma, definitions, and confidence, and by means of the purity of great love, the establishment of all sentient beings on the path to nirvana.

original: snying rje chen po yongs su dag pas bskal pa dpag tu med par 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pas bar du gcod pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su dag pas bskal pa dpag tu med par 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pas bar du gcod pa dang /
translated: Through the perfection of the ten powers, they know the superior and inferior faculties of all sentient beings.üîΩThrough the perfection of fearlessness, they realize what is an obstacle and what is not an obstacle.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos ma yin pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dus gsum la mi chags pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos ma yin pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dus gsum la mi chags pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
translated: Through the perfection of the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, they see the wisdom that is not attached to the three times, the past, the future, and the present.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas rang byung gi ye shes rab tu rtogs pa ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa dam pa /üîΩbzang po / mchog /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas rang byung gi ye shes rab tu rtogs pa ste / sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa dam pa / bzang po / mchog /
translated: Through the perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha, they realize self-arisen wisdom.üîΩThese are the ten causes of the supreme,

original: rab / bye brag tu 'phags pa bcu po de dag gi rgyur @379a *//
analyzed: rab / bye brag tu 'phags pa bcu po de dag gi rgyur @379a *//
translated: the excellent, the best,üîΩthe excellent, the special, the unsurpassed, the holy,üîΩthe good, the supreme,üîΩand the excellent qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'gyur ro // des don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // des don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas /
translated: Seeing this benefit,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs gsog pa la chog mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs gsog pa la chog mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be insatiable in accumulating the equipment of merit.

original: de bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag la mi dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi thams cad du bag chags su yang mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag la mi dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi thams cad du bag chags su yang mi 'gyur bar bya'o snyam nas brtson par byed do //
translated: He will strive to prevent all unwholesome dharmas from arising in himself, even in the form of latent tendencies, by not producing unwholesome compositional activities.

original: de mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rab tu shes nas mi g-yo ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed kyang /
analyzed: de mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams rab tu shes nas mi g-yo ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed kyang /
translated: Having understood the compositional activities that are unshakable, he will generate the meditative concentration that is unshakable.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la snying por 'du shes par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la snying por 'du shes par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: But he will not consider that meditative concentration to be the essence.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis kyang mi skye ste /
translated: He will not be reborn by the power of meditative concentration,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su yang skye'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su yang skye'o //
translated: but by the power of his prayers, he will be reborn in the desire realm in order to accumulate the equipment of merit and to ripen sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas shing byang chub tu sgrub pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag sgom la /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas shing byang chub tu sgrub pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag sgom la /
translated: dwells in the application of mindfulness that observes phenomena and cultivates those phenomena that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de dag spong yang dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du byed pas rtag par lta bar mi ltung /
analyzed: byang chub kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de dag spong yang dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du byed pas rtag par lta bar mi ltung /
translated: Although he abandons those phenomena that are not conducive to enlightenment, he does not fall into the view of eternalism because he accumulates virtuous phenomena.

original: mi dge ba'i chos spong yang chad par lta bar yang mi ltung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spong yang chad par lta bar yang mi ltung ste /
translated: Although he abandons non-virtuous phenomena, he does not fall into the view of nihilism.
