original: gang la chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag pa dang chad pa yongs su spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: gang la chad pa med cing rtag pa med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtag pa dang chad pa yongs su spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: That which is neither nihilistic nor eternalistic is the middle path of the bodhisattva that abandons eternalism and nihilism.

original: @379b de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: @379b de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / ma rig pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste gang de gnyis kyi dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / ma rig pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste gang de gnyis kyi dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The middle way is not a designation, nor is it something to be designated.

original: 'di ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'du byed med pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs med pa dang / skye mched drug dang /
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o // de bzhin du ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'du byed med pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs med pa dang / skye mched drug dang /
translated: This is called the middle way of phenomena.

original: skye mched drug med pa dang / reg pa dang / reg pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / sred pa dang / sred pa med pa dang / len pa dang / len pa med pa dang / srid pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched drug med pa dang / reg pa dang / reg pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba med pa dang / sred pa dang / sred pa med pa dang / len pa dang / len pa med pa dang / srid pa dang /
translated: Similarly, ignorance and formation, non-formation, consciousness and non-consciousness, name-and-form and non-name-and-form, the six sense sources and non-six sense sources, contact and non-contact, feeling and non-feeling, craving and non-craving, grasping and non-grasping, existence and non-existence, birth and non-birth, aging and death and non-aging and non-death are all extremes.üîΩThe middle way is not a designation, nor is it something to be designated.üîΩThis is called the middle way of phenomena.

original: srid pa med pa dang / skye ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / rga shi dang / rga shi med pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: srid pa med pa dang / skye ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / rga shi dang / rga shi med pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: Existence and nonexistence, arising and nonarising, old age and death, sorrow and lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and disturbance‚Äîall of these are extremes.

original: gang de gnyis kyi dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang de gnyis kyi dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The middle way between these two is not a label, nor is it something to be labeled.

original: 'di ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the middle way of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam de ni 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam de ni 'di 'dra'o //
translated: The middle way of phenomena is like this.

original: de 'dra'o zhes bstan par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de 'dra'o zhes bstan par mi rung ste /
translated: It cannot be taught as ‚Äúlike this.‚Äù

original: dbu ma'i lam la ni btags pa med pa /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam la ni btags pa med pa /
translated: The middle way is not a label,

original: gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa /
translated: nor is it something to be labeled.

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: It is without characteristics,

original: gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa /
translated: without abiding,

original: gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa /
translated: without grasping,

original: kun gzhi med pa /
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa /
translated: without foundation,üîΩpeaceful,

original: zhi ba / rab tu zhi ba /üîΩnye bar @380a *//üîΩzhi ba'o // rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: zhi ba / rab tu zhi ba / nye bar @380a *// zhi ba'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: very peaceful,üîΩand completely peaceful.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this.

original: dper na / mda' gang nas 'phangs pa dang / gang du phog pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: dper na / mda' gang nas 'phangs pa dang / gang du phog pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: the place from which an arrow is shot and the place where it lands are both extremes.üîΩThe space that the arrow passes through and the space that it lands in are the middle way.

original: gang phigs pa dang / phog pa de ni dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang phigs pa dang / phog pa de ni dbu ma de ni btags pa med cing gdags par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not a designation, nor is it something to be designated.

original: blta ba'am reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: blta ba'am reg par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: It cannot be seen or touched.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dmigs pa gang gis rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gang du so sor rnam par rig pa gnas pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang gis rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / gang du so sor rnam par rig pa gnas pa de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: the place where consciousness arises due to an object and the place where individual awareness abides are both extremes.

original: gang de gnyis kyis dbu mar bstan par mi nus pa ni /
analyzed: gang de gnyis kyis dbu mar bstan par mi nus pa ni /
translated: The middle way cannot be taught as something between those two.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: brda tsam du dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'i /
analyzed: brda tsam du dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'i /
translated: the middle way is merely a designation.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not ultimate.

original: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni brjod du med de /
analyzed: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni brjod du med de /
translated: What is ultimate is inexpressible.

original: de la ni nyung ngu yang med /
analyzed: de la ni nyung ngu yang med /
translated: There is nothing small about it,

original: mang po yang med do //üîΩgang la nyung ngu yang med /
analyzed: mang po yang med do // gang la nyung ngu yang med /
translated: and there is nothing large about it.

original: mang po yang med pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: mang po yang med pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: What is neither small nor large is the middle way.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang bdag dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: Moreover, the self and the non-self are both extremes.

original: bdag dang / bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The purity of the self and the non-self is the middle way.

original: srog dang / gang zag ces bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: srog dang / gang zag ces bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: The life-force and the person are both extremes.

original: srog dang / gang zag gi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: srog dang / gang zag gi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The purity of the life-force and the person is the middle way.

original: mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: The sign and the signless are both extremes.

original: mtshan ma med par rtog pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par rtog pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The non-conceptualization of the signless is the middle way.

original: dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: The observation and the non-observation are both extremes.

original: rtog @380b pa dang / 'jig pa med pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: rtog @380b pa dang / 'jig pa med pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The non-existence of conceptualization and destruction is the middle way.

original: rdzun pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: rdzun pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: The false and the true are both extremes.

original: brjod du med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The inexpressible is the middle way.

original: tshu rol dang / pha rol ces bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: tshu rol dang / pha rol ces bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: This shore and the other shore are both extremes.

original: 'jig tshogs 'gag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs 'gag pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The cessation of the perishing of the perishable is the middle way.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe conditioned and the unconditioned‚Äù are two extremes.

original: spyod pa med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: spyod pa med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The absence of activity is the middle way.

original: 'khor ba dang; mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang; mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de gnyi ga yang mtha' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù are two extremes.

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
translated: The absence of cognition is the middle way.üîΩ‚Äú

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir dran pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir dran pa la gnas te /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva who observes phenomena and abides in the application of mindfulness of phenomena abides in mindfulness because the realm of phenomena is indivisible.

original: de chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'du bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su 'du bar rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that all phenomena are included in the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de nyid sems can gyi khams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de nyid sems can gyi khams so //
translated: The realm of phenomena is the realm of sentient beings.

original: de chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pas sems can gyi khams dbyer med par khong du chud do //
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pas sems can gyi khams dbyer med par khong du chud do //
translated: He understands that the realm of sentient beings is indivisible because the realm of phenomena is indivisible.

original: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa dang / sems can gyi khams gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang nam mkha'i dbyings dang mtshungs par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa dang / sems can gyi khams gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang nam mkha'i dbyings dang mtshungs par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows that the realm of phenomena and the realm of sentient beings are both like the realm of space.

original: des chos thams cad dbyings gcig tu shes nas chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang chos la mngon par chags shing lta bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos thams cad dbyings gcig tu shes nas chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang chos la mngon par chags shing lta bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHe knows all phenomena to be of one realm, and he abides in the observation of phenomena, yet he does not become attached to phenomena or view them.

original: de nam mi mthong ba de na chos rnams la tha dad du mi byed do //
analyzed: de nam mi mthong ba de na chos rnams la tha dad du mi byed do //
translated: When he does not see, he does not differentiate phenomena.

original: @381a *// des chos rnams la mthong yang sha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: @381a *// des chos rnams la mthong yang sha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúHe sees phenomena, but he does not see with the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
translated: He does not see with the divine eye.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: He does not see with the eye of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i mig mtshan mar 'du shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i mig mtshan mar 'du shes pa ma yin te /
translated: His eye is not a perception of signs.

original: de'i phyir de sha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir de sha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin /
translated: Therefore, he does not see with the fleshly eye.

original: de'i mig mngon par 'du byed par ltung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i mig mngon par 'du byed par ltung ba ma yin te /
translated: His eye does not fall into the accumulation of activity.

original: de'i phyir de lha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lha'i mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not seen by the divine eye.

original: de'i mig spros pa la spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i mig spros pa la spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: His eye does not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: de'i phyir de shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not seen by the eye of wisdom.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas chos gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas chos gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he abides in the observation of phenomena, he sees all phenomena as they are and does not abide in any phenomenon.

original: de chos thams cad mi gnas par shes nas chos rjes su dran pa des sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: de chos thams cad mi gnas par shes nas chos rjes su dran pa des sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba 'di ni /
translated: Knowing that all phenomena are nonabiding, he does not abandon his previous aspirations.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: This, noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'o //
translated: is the bodhisattvas‚Äô recollection of the Dharma, which is approved by the buddhas.

original: gang cung zad chos zab mo la so sor rtog kyang /
analyzed: gang cung zad chos zab mo la so sor rtog kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever slight investigation there is into the profound Dharma,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa de yang mi 'dor ba 'di ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems rjes su dran pa de yang mi 'dor ba 'di ni /
translated: he does not abandon the recollection of the mind of awakening toward omniscience.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: This, noble son,üîΩis the bodhisattvas‚Äô recollection of the mind of awakening, which is approved by the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva‚Äôs pure practice of the application of mindfulness that observes phenomena in phenomena.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi po de dag la gnas pa de phyin ci log bzhi rab tu spong ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi po de dag la gnas pa de phyin ci log bzhi rab tu spong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is established in these four applications of mindfulness abandons the four errors.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing @381b gnas pas mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing @381b gnas pas mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By observing the body in the body, he abandons the error of perceiving the pleasant in the unpleasant.

original: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By observing feelings in feelings, he abandons the error of perceiving happiness in suffering.

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By observing the mind in the mind, he abandons the error of perceiving permanence in impermanence.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa'i phyin ci log rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By abiding in the observation of the Dharma, he abandons the error of perceiving a self in the absence of self.

original: de phyin ci log med pas yang dag pa nyid bsgrub bo //
analyzed: de phyin ci log med pas yang dag pa nyid bsgrub bo //
translated: Since he is free from error, he accomplishes reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid la zhugs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid la zhugs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered into reality, all the bodhisattva practices become pure.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa de yang dag par spong ba'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa de yang dag par spong ba'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva who has purified his conduct attains the purification of the practice of the correct exertions.

original: yang dag par spong ba'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purification of the practice of the correct exertions?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de 'bad pa med cing lhun gyis grub pas dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba la sems 'jug gi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de 'bad pa med cing lhun gyis grub pas dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba la sems 'jug gi /
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs mind engages in the practice of virtuous qualities effortlessly and spontaneously,

original: mi dge ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in non-virtuous qualities.

original: de phyir zhing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /üîΩdge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang nyams par mi @382a *//
analyzed: de phyir zhing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang nyams par mi @382a *//
translated: Therefore, he exerts effort to abandon the sinful and nonvirtuous dharmas that have arisen, to prevent the sinful and nonvirtuous dharmas that have not arisen from arising, to produce the virtuous dharmas that have not arisen,

original: 'gyur ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: and to preserve, increase, and perfect the virtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de sngon gyi las yongs su dag pa'i phyir rang gi ngang nyid kyis dge ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de sngon gyi las yongs su dag pa'i phyir rang gi ngang nyid kyis dge ba'i chos rnams mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: because the bodhisattva has purified his past actions, the virtuous dharmas manifest by their very nature.

original: 'bad ba med cing lhun gyis grub pas dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni skye'o //
analyzed: 'bad ba med cing lhun gyis grub pas dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni skye'o //
translated: Without effort and spontaneously, the virtuous dharmas that have not arisen arise,

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the wholesome dharmas that have arisen will not be lost.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa de yang dag par spong ba bzhi po 'di dag sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa de yang dag par spong ba bzhi po 'di dag sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva who has purified his conduct will master these four right efforts with his mind,

original: brtson 'grus kyis dbang bsgyur bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis dbang bsgyur bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not with his diligence.

original: de dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / kha na mtho  ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gnang ba'i byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / kha na mtho  ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gnang ba'i byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug ste /
translated: With a mind and mental states that are pure, stainless, free from reproach, and approved by the Buddhas, he will engage in great loving kindness and great compassion.

original: yang dag pa la zhugs pa de ni yang dag par spong ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa la zhugs pa de ni yang dag par spong ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has entered into reality is said to abide in the right efforts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i spong ba mnyam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i spong ba mnyam pa yin gyi /
translated: His abandonment is equal,

original: mi mnyam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not unequal.

original: de'i sbyor ba mnyam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba mnyam pa yin gyi /
translated: His application is equal,

original: mi mnyam pa ma yin no; ;yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par sbyor ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ma yin no; ;yang dag par spong ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par sbyor ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCorrect abandonment‚Äù means that which is applied equally through equality and that which is accomplished equally through equality.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúcorrect abandonment.‚Äù

original: de @382b ltar yang dag par zhugs pa de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de @382b ltar yang dag par zhugs pa de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe four bases of supernatural powers‚Äù means that the four bases of supernatural powers are perfected by one who has thus entered correctly.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩ'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩThe base of supernatural power that possesses the meditative stabilization of aspiration and the formative force of abandonment,üîΩthe base of supernatural power that possesses the meditative stabilization of effort and the formative force of abandonment,üîΩthe base of supernatural power that possesses the meditative stabilization of mind and the formative force of abandonment,

original: dpyod pa'i ting 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: and the base of supernatural power that possesses the meditative stabilization of investigation and the formative force of abandonment.

original: de byang chub kyi sems kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas 'dun pa yang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byang chub kyi sems kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas 'dun pa yang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes light in his aspiration through the superior intention of the mind of awakening.

original: mi dge ba'i chos spong bas brtson 'grus yang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos spong bas brtson 'grus yang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes light in his diligence through abandoning unwholesome qualities.

original: snying rje chen po rab tu thob pas sems yang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po rab tu thob pas sems yang par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes light in his mind through attaining great compassion.

original: thabs mkhas pa rab tu thob pas spyod pa yang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa rab tu thob pas spyod pa yang par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes light in his conduct through attaining skill in means.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po de dag gis byang chub kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrubs pas dbang bzhi rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po de dag gis byang chub kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrubs pas dbang bzhi rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: through these four bases of miraculous power, the bodhisattva attains the four masteries in accomplishing the aspects of awakening.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshe la dbang ba thob bo; ;tshe la dbang ba des 'dod na /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba thob bo; ;tshe la dbang ba des 'dod na /
translated: He attains mastery over life and, through that mastery over life, if he wishes,

original: sems can tshe thung ngu rnams kyi nang du tshe ring po yongs su 'dzin cing sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sems can tshe ring po chos bstan na; yongs su skyo ba rnams la chos bstan pas yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir tshe thung ngu yongs su 'dzin pa dang /üîΩlha'am mi gang dang gang du skye ba thams cad du tshe'i tshad la dbang bsgyur @383a *//
analyzed: sems can tshe thung ngu rnams kyi nang du tshe ring po yongs su 'dzin cing sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sems can tshe ring po chos bstan na; yongs su skyo ba rnams la chos bstan pas yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir tshe thung ngu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / lha'am mi gang dang gang du skye ba thams cad du tshe'i tshad la dbang bsgyur @383a *//
translated: And in order to satisfy those who are weary of teaching the Dharma to those with long lives, they take on short lives.

original: ba yin te /
analyzed: ba yin te /
translated: They have mastery over the length of life in all their births as gods or humans.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpas dbang dang po 'di thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dbang dang po 'di thob bo //
translated: this is the first mastery attained by bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' lus la dbang thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' lus la dbang thob ste /
translated: bodhisattvas also attain mastery over the body.

original: lus la dbang ba des yid kyi lus rab tu thob nas lus ci 'dra ba dang / gzugs ci 'dra ba dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam ci 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang /üîΩ'dul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' de lus dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam kun du ston te /
analyzed: lus la dbang ba des yid kyi lus rab tu thob nas lus ci 'dra ba dang / gzugs ci 'dra ba dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam ci 'dra bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / 'dul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' de lus dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam kun du ston te /
translated: Having attained the mental body through mastery of the body, the bodhisattva can manifest any kind of body, any kind of form, any kind of color, any kind of sign, any kind of shape, and any kind of behavior that will bring sentient beings to maturity.üîΩHe can manifest any kind of body, any kind of form, any kind of color, any kind of sign, any kind of shape, and any kind of behavior that will tame sentient beings.

original: de 'dod na sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de 'dod na sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang / mtshan ma dang / dbyibs dang / spyod lam mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If he wishes, he can make his body, form, color, signs, shape, and behavior the same as all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpas dbang gnyis pa 'di thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dbang gnyis pa 'di thob bo //
translated: this is the second mastery attained by the bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas chos la dbang thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas chos la dbang thob ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas also attain mastery over phenomena.

original: chos la dbang ba des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la rton par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos la dbang ba des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la rton par 'gyur gyi /
translated: By means of this mastery of the Dharma, they rely on the supramundane Dharma and do not rely on the mundane Dharma.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos la rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la rton kyang 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad du yang snang la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos la rton par mi 'gyur ba dang / de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la rton kyang 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad du yang snang la /
translated: Even though they rely on the supramundane Dharma, they also appear in all mundane activities.üîΩAnd even though they do not move from that supramundane wisdom, they also have the wisdom of unimpeded knowledge and the wisdom of profound dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de las kyang mi g-yo ba dang / gang 'di shes rab dang / ye shes chags pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid @383b dang / chos rnam par bsgrubs pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten mos par byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de las kyang mi g-yo ba dang / gang 'di shes rab dang / ye shes chags pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid @383b dang / chos rnam par bsgrubs pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten mos par byed cing /
translated: They also have the wisdom of the accomplishment of the Dharma, and they inspire the world with its gods to have faith.

original: gang gis sems can tshad med pa rnams bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i chos kyi gtam byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis sems can tshad med pa rnams bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i chos kyi gtam byed pa yin te /
translated: They also give Dharma teachings that tame countless beings in accordance with their aspirations and inclinations.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpas dbang gsum pa 'di 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dbang gsum pa 'di 'thob bo //
translated: this is the third empowerment that bodhisattvas obtain.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang thob ste /üîΩbyin gyi rlabs la dbang ba des gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po de dag thams cad rgya mtsho gcig tu byin gyis brlabs kyang 'dres pa yang med la /üîΩspyod pa de yang kun du ston pa dang / gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ri'i rgyal po ri rab de dag thams cad ri gcig tu byin gyis brlabs kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu rnams phan tshun 'phos par yang mi shes la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang thob ste / byin gyi rlabs la dbang ba des gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po de dag thams cad rgya mtsho gcig tu byin gyis brlabs kyang 'dres pa yang med la / spyod pa de yang kun du ston pa dang / gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ri'i rgyal po ri rab de dag thams cad ri gcig tu byin gyis brlabs kyang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu rnams phan tshun 'phos par yang mi shes la /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas have attained mastery of the power of blessing.üîΩWith that mastery of blessing, they can bless all the great oceans in this great trichiliocosm to become a single ocean, without mixing them.üîΩThey can also display that conduct. They can bless all the Sumeru mountains, the kings of mountains, in this great trichiliocosm to become a single mountain, without the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings or the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three noticing each other‚Äôs movements.

original: spyod pa de yang kun du ston pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag ji ltar rin po che'i sa gzhi'am /
analyzed: spyod pa de yang kun du ston pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag ji ltar rin po che'i sa gzhi'am /
translated: They can also display that conduct. They can bless this great trichiliocosm to become a single city, a single house, a single bed, a single seat, a single tree, a single jewel, a single river, a single mountain, a single ocean, a single continent, a single world system, a single sun and moon, a single sky, a single body, a single thought, a single word, a single syllable, or a single name.

original: tsan dan gyi sa gzhi'am /
analyzed: tsan dan gyi sa gzhi'am /
translated: a ground of sandalwood,

original: spos kyi sa gzhi'am /
analyzed: spos kyi sa gzhi'am /
translated: a ground of incense,

original: me tog gi sa gzhi'am /
analyzed: me tog gi sa gzhi'am /
translated: a ground of flowers,

original: nam mkhar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkhar gyur pa'am /
translated: space,

original: chus yongs su gang ba'am /
analyzed: chus yongs su gang ba'am /
translated: water,üîΩfire,

original: mes yongs su gang ba'am /üîΩrin po che thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces de ltar byin gyis brlabs na yang de 'dra bar gnas pa dang / de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs thams @384a *//
analyzed: mes yongs su gang ba'am / rin po che thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar gyur cig ces de ltar byin gyis brlabs na yang de 'dra bar gnas pa dang / de bzhin du byin gyis brlabs thams @384a *//
translated: or all jewels.üîΩAnd when he has blessed it in this way, it remains just as it was blessed.üîΩAnd in the same way, all his blessings are just as they are blessed.

original: cad kyis gang ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa de ltar 'gyur ba dang / de'i sems bskyed ma thag tu byin gyis brlabs thams cad de bzhin du kun du gnas pa yin te /üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: cad kyis gang ji ltar byin gyis brlabs pa de ltar 'gyur ba dang / de'i sems bskyed ma thag tu byin gyis brlabs thams cad de bzhin du kun du gnas pa yin te / rigs kyi bu /
translated: And as soon as he arouses his mind to enlightenment, all his blessings remain just as they are.

original: byang chub sems dpas dbang bzhi pa 'di 'thob bo //üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dbang bzhi pa 'di 'thob bo // rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir, this is the fourth controlling power of a bodhisattva.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la gnas pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la gnas pa /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble sir, the bodhisattva who is established in the four bases of miraculous powers

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas shing 'dug ste gtam zer ro //üîΩde bzhin du tshangs pa thams cad dang / brgya byin thams cad dang / 'jig rten skyong pa thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas shing 'dug ste gtam zer ro // de bzhin du tshangs pa thams cad dang / brgya byin thams cad dang / 'jig rten skyong pa thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: He is in the company of the blessed buddhas of the ten directions, and they converse with him.

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu gnas shing 'dug ste gtam zer ro //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu gnas shing 'dug ste gtam zer ro //
translated: In the same way, he is in the company of all the BrahmƒÅs, all the ≈öakras, all the LokapƒÅlas, and all the gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, asuras, garu·∏ças, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans, and they converse with him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those feet of supernatural power of that bodhisattva are well purified.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the purification of the feet of supernatural power?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lus yang bar bya ba'i phyir bla ma dang / sbyin gnas rnams la ldang ba dang / rim 'gro byed pa dang / gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / thal mo sbyor cing mthun par byed pa dang / ngag yang bar bya ba'i phyir bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin te /
analyzed: lus yang bar bya ba'i phyir bla ma dang / sbyin gnas rnams la ldang ba dang / rim 'gro byed pa dang / gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / thal mo sbyor cing mthun par byed pa dang / ngag yang bar bya ba'i phyir bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin te /
translated: In order to make the body light, one rises for gurus and those worthy of honor, goes to them, speaks respectfully, prostrates, joins palms in homage, and acts in accord with them.üîΩIn order to make the speech light, one is agreeable and has a cheerful manner.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / sems yang bar bya @384b ba'i phyir nga rgyal med pa dang / zhe 'gras pa med pa dang / bla ma la rim gro byed cing gus pa dang / 'dud pa dang / rab tu 'dud pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / sems yang bar bya @384b ba'i phyir nga rgyal med pa dang / zhe 'gras pa med pa dang / bla ma la rim gro byed cing gus pa dang / 'dud pa dang / rab tu 'dud pa dang /
translated: In order to make the mind light, one is without pride, without hostility, and serves, respects, bows to, and prostrates to gurus.

original: sems las su rung ba dang / sems la yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / spong ba rnams la brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / bden pa'i brtul zhugs rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi lhod par brtson pa dang / dgos pa grub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba dang / sems la yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / spong ba rnams la brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / bden pa'i brtul zhugs rdzogs par byed pa dang / mi lhod par brtson pa dang / dgos pa grub par byed pa dang /
translated: One has a serviceable mind, a mind without torment, does not abandon striving in the eliminations, completes the discipline of truth, strives without being lax, and accomplishes what needs to be done.

original: snyoms las mi byed pa dang / sems mi zhum pa dang / 'dod chags rnam par sel ba dang / zhe sdang nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa sel ba dang / 'dod pa med pa dang / phrag dog med pa dang /
analyzed: snyoms las mi byed pa dang / sems mi zhum pa dang / 'dod chags rnam par sel ba dang / zhe sdang nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa sel ba dang / 'dod pa med pa dang / phrag dog med pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is to be diligent, to be indefatigable, to be undaunted, to eliminate desire, to pacify anger, to dispel the darkness of ignorance, to be free of desire, to be free of envy,

original: ser sna dang bral ba dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la sbyor ba dang / gzhan gyi dgos pa bsgrub cing khur khyer ba dang / nyam chung ba rnams kyi khur sgrol ba dang / 'dam rdzab la stegs 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: ser sna dang bral ba dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la sbyor ba dang / gzhan gyi dgos pa bsgrub cing khur khyer ba dang / nyam chung ba rnams kyi khur sgrol ba dang / 'dam rdzab la stegs 'dogs pa dang /
translated: to be free of avarice, to apply oneself to the higher intention, to fulfill the needs of others and to carry their burdens, to liberate the burdens of the weak, to build bridges over swamps,

original: klung la zam pas sgrol ba dang / chu bo la gru sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dga' ba'i tshig thos par byed pa dang; gzhan gyi nyes pa mi gleng ba dang / nyes pa byung ba rnams gso bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: klung la zam pas sgrol ba dang / chu bo la gru sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dga' ba'i tshig thos par byed pa dang; gzhan gyi nyes pa mi gleng ba dang / nyes pa byung ba rnams gso bar byed pa dang /
translated: to build bridges over rivers, to build boats on rivers, to fulfill the wishes of beings, to hear pleasant words, to not speak of the faults of others, to heal those who have faults,üîΩand to be free of pride.

original: 'gyod pa rnams sel ba dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams rnam par sel ba dang / khams gang gis 'byung ba khong du chud pa dang / phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa rnams sel ba dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams rnam par sel ba dang / khams gang gis 'byung ba khong du chud pa dang / phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med pa dang /
translated: It is to eliminate regret. It is to eliminate all agitation. It is to understand the elements. It is to give away all cherished things. It is to have no regret after giving.

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba'i phyir byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / @385a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba'i phyir byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / @385a *//
translated: It is to dedicate one‚Äôs awakening to all beings.

original: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / gzhan dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag bar 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bdag bde ba la mi chags pa dang / bde ba gzhan la stob pa dang; bdag gi rnyed pas chog shes pa dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa la phrag dog med pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / gzhan dag dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag bar 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bdag bde ba la mi chags pa dang / bde ba gzhan la stob pa dang; bdag gi rnyed pas chog shes pa dang / gzhan gyi rnyed pa la phrag dog med pa dang /
translated: It is to be preceded by faith. It is to cause others to take up the roots of virtue. It is to not be attached to one‚Äôs own happiness. It is to bring about the happiness of others. It is to be content with one‚Äôs own gain. It is to not be jealous of the gain of others.

original: rab tu byung ba la gzhol ba dang / gzhan dag kyang rab tu byang ba la mos par byed pa dang / byas pa bzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / mdza' ba brtan pa dang / mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la gzhol ba dang / gzhan dag kyang rab tu byang ba la mos par byed pa dang / byas pa bzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / mdza' ba brtan pa dang / mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa dang /
translated: It is to be dedicated to going forth. It is to inspire others to aspire to going forth. It is to be grateful. It is to be appreciative. It is to have firm love. It is to have an attitude of equality toward friends and enemies.

original: rta dang / glang po che dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung sbyin pa dang / ngal ba rnams yang dag par spro bar byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / bslab pa rnams la ston pa tsam du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rta dang / glang po che dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung sbyin pa dang / ngal ba rnams yang dag par spro bar byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / bslab pa rnams la ston pa tsam du phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to give horses, elephants, chariots, and infantry. It is to encourage those who are tired. It is to give freedom from fear to all beings. It is to hold the precepts as dear as a teacher.

original: ma bslabs pa rnams la mi brnyas pa dang / dbul po rnams la longs spyod 'gyed pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi g-yog byed pa dang / sman sbyin pa dang / byas pa rnams la mi smod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la rim gro byed pa dang /
analyzed: ma bslabs pa rnams la mi brnyas pa dang / dbul po rnams la longs spyod 'gyed pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi g-yog byed pa dang / sman sbyin pa dang / byas pa rnams la mi smod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la rim gro byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not despise those who are untrained. It is to give wealth to the poor. It is to serve the sick. It is to give medicine. It is to not criticize those who have done something. It is to serve the Three Jewels.

original: bsti stang byed pa dang / bsti stang mi byed pa rnams la btang snyoms pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos las shin tu 'da' pa dang / sdig pa thams cad shin tu mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa dang /
analyzed: bsti stang byed pa dang / bsti stang mi byed pa rnams la btang snyoms pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos las shin tu 'da' pa dang / sdig pa thams cad shin tu mi byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa dang /
translated: They are: being indifferent to those who honor them and those who do not; being beyond all worldly concerns; not engaging in any evil; not being defiled by any worldly phenomena;

original: yon tan thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba dang / dran pa mi nyams @385b pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba dang / dran pa mi nyams @385b pa ste /
translated: cultivating all good qualities; being preceded by the mind of awakening; and not losing mindfulness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: this is the purification of the bodhisattvas‚Äô bases of miraculous powers.

original: de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams yongs su sbyangs nas byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams yongs su sbyangs nas byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du nyams par mi 'gyur /
translated: Having thus purified the bases of miraculous powers, they will not decline until they reach the seat of awakening.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not decline.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the bases of miraculous powers.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the faculties consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mi 'phrogs pa dad pa'i dbang po dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dran pa'i dbang po dang / snying rje chen po mi gtong ba ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa dad pa'i dbang po dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa dran pa'i dbang po dang / snying rje chen po mi gtong ba ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang /
translated: The faculty of faith is not to be robbed. The faculty of diligence is not to be led astray by others. The faculty of mindfulness is not to forget the mind of awakening. The faculty of absorption is not to abandon great compassion.

original: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par brtson pa shes rab kyi dbang po'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par brtson pa shes rab kyi dbang po'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: The faculty of insight is to be diligent in embracing all phenomena.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mos shing dad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mos shing dad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, aspiring to and having faith in all the qualities of the buddhas is the bodhisattvas‚Äô faculty of faith.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrubs pas yongs su mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrubs pas yongs su mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: Not being discouraged by the accomplishment of all the qualities of the buddhas is the faculty of diligence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Not forgetting all the qualities of the buddhas is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the accomplishment of all the buddhas‚Äô meditative absorptions.

original: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom bcad par yongs su bsngos pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom bcad par yongs su bsngos pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the dedication to the elimination of the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /üîΩgzhan yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub dang bsam pa mi @386a *//üîΩphyed par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gzhan yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub dang bsam pa mi @386a *// phyed par gyur pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva‚Äôs faculty of faith is the indivisibility of the intention and awakening of all the buddhas.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa khyad par du 'gro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa khyad par du 'gro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of diligence is the progress of the superior intention.

original: yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the skill in dedication.

original: sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the even emission of light rays to all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su shes pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su shes pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the knowledge of the faculties of all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad chags pa las shin tu 'da' bar byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad chags pa las shin tu 'da' bar byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva‚Äôs faculty of faith is the transcendence of all attachment.

original: sems can thams cad chags pa las shin tu thar bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad chags pa las shin tu thar bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of perseverance is the liberation of all beings from attachment.

original: gang la yang mi chags pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang la yang mi chags pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the absence of attachment to anything.

original: sems can thams cad kyi chags pa mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi chags pa mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of meditative stability is the realization of the equality of all beings‚Äô attachments.

original: gang chags pa dang mi chags pa thams cad shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang chags pa dang mi chags pa thams cad shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the knowledge of all attachments and non-attachments.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang gang rnyog pa med par gyur pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang rnyog pa med par gyur pa 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of faith is the absence of mental turbidity.

original: sems rnyog pa can dang par byed pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems rnyog pa can dang par byed pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of perseverance is the purification of a turbid mind.

original: gang rnyog pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi dran pa mi 'dor ba 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang rnyog pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi dran pa mi 'dor ba 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the non-abandonment of the nature of non-turbidity.

original: gang sems rnyog pa med par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldang ba shes pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang sems rnyog pa med par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldang ba shes pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the knowledge of entering into and rising from concentration without disturbing the mind.

original: gang @386b rnyog pa med pa'i chos thos pas rnyog pa can du gyur pa rnams rnyog pa med pa'i chos nyid la rab tu 'god pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gang @386b rnyog pa med pa'i chos thos pas rnyog pa can du gyur pa rnams rnyog pa med pa'i chos nyid la rab tu 'god pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the knowledge of establishing those whose minds are disturbed in the nature of the Dharma, by means of hearing the undisturbing Dharma.

original: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, the faculty of faith of the bodhisattvas is the abandonment of all non-virtuous dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of diligence is the complete accomplishment of all virtuous dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad bsgrub pa dang / ma bsgrub pa rnams mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad bsgrub pa dang / ma bsgrub pa rnams mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the non-forgetting of all virtuous dharmas, both those that have been accomplished and those that have not.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba dang / bde ba mi 'dod cing sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba dang / bde ba mi 'dod cing sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the concentration that is not desirous of the joy and bliss of meditative concentration, but is cultivated for the benefit and welfare of all sentient beings.

original: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du so so rang gis shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du so so rang gis shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the individual knowledge of the equality of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dad pas ni 'dor ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dad pas ni 'dor ro //
translated: furthermore, bodhisattvas give up through faith,

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni yang dag par bsgrub bo //
translated: they accomplish through diligence,

original: dran pas ni chud mi gson to //
analyzed: dran pas ni chud mi gson to //
translated: they do not lose through mindfulness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni bsrung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni bsrung ngo //
translated: they protect through concentration,

original: shes rab kyis ni rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rnam par 'byed do //
translated: and they analyze through wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dad pas ni bdag tu 'dzin pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dad pas ni bdag tu 'dzin pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, furthermore, bodhisattvas give up through faith,

analyzed: dran pas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba las shin tu 'da'o;/

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis 'dor ro //

analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor bar gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ste /
translated: Through wisdom, one abandons the afflictions that are the connections of habitual tendencies.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,
this is

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the faculties.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct of the powers?

original: gang dbang po de dag gis nye bar brtan nas bdud thams cad kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po 'di las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang dbang po de dag gis nye bar brtan nas bdud thams cad kyis mi rdzi bar 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po 'di las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Having stabilized those faculties, one is not overwhelmed by any demons, one is not carried away by the two vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and one does not turn back from the Great Vehicle.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi thul bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi dam bcas pa la brtan par 'gyur ba dang / sems kyis shin tu brtan par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyis stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rnams sbed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi thul bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi dam bcas pa la brtan par 'gyur ba dang / sems kyis shin tu brtan par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyis stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rnams sbed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: His faculties are hidden.üîΩHe cannot be harmed by enemies.

analyzed: dgra rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ba dang / bas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He cannot be shaken by any adversary.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dad pa'i stobs kyis bya ba ma yin pa mi byed do //
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva, through the power of faith, does not do what should not be done.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bya ba byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bya ba byed do //

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byas pa'i las chud mi gzon to //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byas pa'i las chud mi gzon to //
translated: Through the power of mindfulness, he does not waste the actions he has done.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams la rma mi 'byin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa rnams la rma mi 'byin to //
translated: Through the power of concentration, he is not wounded by forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni 'gyod pa dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad las shin tu 'da'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni 'gyod pa dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad las shin tu 'da'o //
translated: By the power of wisdom, he transcends all regrets and all mental disturbances.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni yang gzhan la dad pas mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni yang gzhan la dad pas mi 'gro'o //
translated: furthermore, by the power of faith, a bodhisattva does not follow others.

original: @387b brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bar ma dor zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @387b brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bar ma dor zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of diligence, he does not become discouraged in the middle.

analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni gzungs dang / spobs pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, he attains dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ and eloquence.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni mtshungs par chos ston to; ;shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni mtshungs par chos ston to; ;shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod do //
translated: By the power of samƒÅdhi, he teaches the Dharma in a way that is consistent. By the power of wisdom, he cuts through all the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni mos pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni mos pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: furthermore, by the power of faith, a bodhisattva perfects the power of aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni rnam par grol ba'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni rnam par grol ba'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni sems dang bsam pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni sems dang bsam pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa tshim par byed do //
translated: By the power of prajna, he satisfies the conduct of all beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni ser sna'i dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni ser sna'i dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
translated: furthermore, by the power of faith, the bodhisattva abandons the stain of stinginess.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bdag gi bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bdag gi bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ngo //

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, he dedicates to enlightenment.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni mnyam pa'i sems kyis mi 'dor ro //

analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni rnam par smin pa la re ba med do //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Moreover, by the power of faith, the bodhisattva eliminates the stain of immorality.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni @388a *//
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni @388a *//
translated: By the power of effort,

original: bslab pa rnams las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: bslab pa rnams las mi 'da'o //

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, he dedicates to enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / cang shes kyis la 'gro'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / cang shes kyis la 'gro'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i tshul khrims rab tu spong ngo //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni gnod sems kyi dri ma rab tu spong ngo //

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bzod pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bzod pa bsgom mo //
translated: By the power of effort, he cultivates patience.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, he dedicates to enlightenment.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad rnams rjes su bsrung ngo //

analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni bdag dang / sems can dang / bzod pa la rnam par mi rtog go /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni le lo'i dri ma rab tu spong ngo //

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni rtsom pa thams cad nyams 'og tu chud par byed do //

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Through the power of mindfulness, one dedicates to awakening.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bsgrub bo //üîΩshes rab kyi stobs kyis ni mi byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bsgrub bo // shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni mi byed /
translated: Through the power of samƒÅdhi, one accomplishes physical and mental pliancy.

original: rnam par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi byed do //
translated: Through the power of wisdom, one does not act or create.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
translated: furthermore, through the power of faith, a bodhisattva abandons the stain of distraction.

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni bsam gtan gyi yan lag rnams yang dag par bsgrub @388b bo; ;dran pa'i stobs kyis ni rtse gcig tu yongs su bsngo'o //
