original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo'o //
translated: By the power of samƒÅdhi, one does not waver from samƒÅdhi.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni bsam gtan de la chags pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni bsam gtan de la chags pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By the power of wisdom, one abandons attachment to those meditations.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi dri ma rab tu spong ngo //
translated: furthermore, by the power of faith, a bodhisattva abandons the stains of wrong understanding.üîΩBy the power of diligence, one seeks out what one has heard.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni thos pa yongs su tshol lo; ;dran pa'i stobs kyis ni tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni thos pa yongs su tshol lo; ;dran pa'i stobs kyis ni tshul bzhin la rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, one applies oneself properly.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni sems nges par sems pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni sems nges par sems pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: By the power of samƒÅdhi, one attains the ascertainment of mind.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni nan tan gyis yang dag par bsgrub bo //
translated: By the power of wisdom, one accomplishes through practice.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni nor bdun rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis ni nor bdun rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Moreover, by the power of faith, the bodhisattva obtains the seven riches.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: By the power of vigor, he obtains the seven limbs of enlightenment.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni rjes su dran pa drug rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni rjes su dran pa drug rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, he obtains the six remembrances.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun las shin tu 'da'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun las shin tu 'da'o //
translated: By the power of concentration, he transcends the seven abodes of consciousness.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni log pa nyid du nges pa brgyad las shin tu 'da'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni log pa nyid du nges pa brgyad las shin tu 'da'o //
translated: By the power of wisdom, he transcends the eight bases of false views.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang gang mi phyed cing sems dang / bsam pa rnyog pa med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang mi phyed cing sems dang / bsam pa rnyog pa med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyis spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, when one is not divided and one‚Äôs mind and thoughts are free of turbidity, this is the purification of conduct by the power of faith of the bodhisattva.

original: gang phyir mi ldog cing blang ba med la dor ba med pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir mi ldog cing blang ba med la dor ba med pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: When one does not turn back, does not accept, and does not reject, this is the purification of conduct by the power of vigor.

original: gang dran pa sngon du 'gro la dran pa med @389a *//
analyzed: gang dran pa sngon du 'gro la dran pa med @389a *//
translated: It is to be without recollection and without mental activity, while still being guided by recollection.

original: cing yid la byed pa med pa 'di ni dran pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: cing yid la byed pa med pa 'di ni dran pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the practice of the power of recollection.üîΩIt is to know how to enter and rise from concentration and relinquishment through the natural training of the mind.

original: gang sems rab tu dul bas rang bzhin gyis ting nge 'dzin dang spongs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba shes pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems rab tu dul bas rang bzhin gyis ting nge 'dzin dang spongs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba shes pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the practice of the power of concentration.üîΩIt is to be skilled in dispelling all views.

original: gang lta ba thams cad sel ba la mkhas pa 'di ni shes rab kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang lta ba thams cad sel ba la mkhas pa 'di ni shes rab kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the practice of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: gzhan yang dang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: furthermore, the characteristic of clarity is the purity of the bodhisattva‚Äôs practice of the power of faith.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of irreversibility is the purity of the practice of the power of diligence.

original: mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i mtshan nyid ni dran pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-forgetfulness is the purity of conduct through the power of mindfulness.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-distraction is the purity of conduct through the power of samƒÅdhi.

original: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of discernment is the purity of conduct through the power of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct through the powers.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure conduct through the branches of awakening?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni bdun te; bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni bdun te; bdun gang zhe na /
translated: the bodhisattvas‚Äô branches of awakening are said to be seven. What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @389b dang; dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag @389b dang; dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the branch of awakening concerned with correct pliancy,üîΩthe branch of awakening concerned with correct meditative absorption,

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: and the branch of awakening concerned with correct equanimity.

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsags shing bsags pa rnams chud mi gzon pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsags shing bsags pa rnams chud mi gzon pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe branch of awakening concerned with correct mindfulness is the non-negligence of the factors of awakening that have been accumulated and gathered.

original: 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the branch of awakening concerned with correct mindfulness.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang lhag mthong gi tshogs dang zung du 'brel par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang lhag mthong gi tshogs dang zung du 'brel par gyur pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe branch of awakening concerned with correct discernment of the Dharma is the union of the factors of awakening with the accumulation of profound insight.

original: 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the factor of perfect awakening that is the discernment of phenomena.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang spong ba khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang spong ba khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The factor of perfect awakening that is effort is what makes one progress in terms of what is to be eliminated.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the factor of perfect awakening that is effort.

original: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang mi dga' ba sel bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang mi dga' ba sel bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The factor of perfect awakening that is joy is what dispels unhappiness.

original: 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the factor of perfect awakening that is joy.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang lus dang sems shin tu byang bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang lus dang sems shin tu byang bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The factor of perfect awakening that is pliancy is what makes the body and mind very pliable.

original: 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the factor of perfect awakening that is pliancy.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang rnam par grol ba snying por 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang rnam par grol ba snying por 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The factor of perfect awakening that is samƒÅdhi is what makes the essence of liberation.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: This is the factor of perfect awakening that is samƒÅdhi.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang byed pa byas par 'gyur ba yin te /üîΩ'di ni btang snyoms yang @390a *//
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang byed pa byas par 'gyur ba yin te / 'di ni btang snyoms yang @390a *//
translated: The limb of enlightenment of equanimity is the completion of what is to be done.

original: dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is the limb of enlightenment of equanimity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang byang chub kyi bsam pa ma brjed pa 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub kyi bsam pa ma brjed pa 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: furthermore, the non-forgetfulness of the intention for enlightenment is the limb of enlightenment of mindfulness.

original: gang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: The diligence in upholding the sublime Dharma is the limb of enlightenment of the investigation of phenomena.

original: gang sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yongs su mi skyo ba 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gang sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yongs su mi skyo ba 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: The non-exhaustion due to the ripening of sentient beings is the limb of enlightenment of effort.

original: gang dam pa'i chos kyi kun dga' la dga' bas gnas pa 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos kyi kun dga' la dga' bas gnas pa 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: The abiding in delight through delight in the sublime Dharma is the limb of enlightenment of joy.

original: gang shin tu sbyangs pa la sems can rnams 'god pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /üîΩgang ting nge 'dzin la sems can rnams 'god pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gang shin tu sbyangs pa la sems can rnams 'god pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go / gang ting nge 'dzin la sems can rnams 'god pa 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: The factor of enlightenment of pliancy is the establishment of sentient beings in pliancy.üîΩThe factor of enlightenment of meditative stabilization is the establishment of sentient beings in meditative stabilization.

original: gang mngon sum du shes pa btang snyoms la sems can rnams rab tu 'god pa 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: gang mngon sum du shes pa btang snyoms la sems can rnams rab tu 'god pa 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: The factor of enlightenment of equanimity is the establishment of sentient beings in the equanimity of direct knowledge.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis dran pa med cing yid la mi byed pa 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis dran pa med cing yid la mi byed pa 'di ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: furthermore, the practice of the factor of enlightenment of mindfulness that is free from the two vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas is the purity of the practice of the factor of enlightenment of mindfulness.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i ye shes la mkhas pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i ye shes la mkhas pa 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The skill in the knowledge of the analysis of the words of all the teachings is the pure activity of the factor of awakening that is the discrimination of phenomena.

original: gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las brtul ba 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa @390b yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las brtul ba 'di ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa @390b yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The discipline of physical, verbal, and mental actions is the pure activity of the factor of awakening that is diligence.

original: gang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong ba 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba spong ba 'di ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of attachment and aversion is the pure activity of the factor of awakening that is joy.

original: gang bya ba byas pa dang / byed pa byas pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang bya ba byas pa dang / byed pa byas pa 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The completion of what is to be done and the completion of the action is the pure activity of the factor of awakening that is pliancy.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug kyang gcig tu snyoms par zhugs par yang 'gyur ba 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //üîΩgang gnyis su med pa'i chos la rab tu gnas te rtog pa dang sel ba med cing btang snyoms par kun tu snang la /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug kyang gcig tu snyoms par zhugs par yang 'gyur ba 'di ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o // gang gnyis su med pa'i chos la rab tu gnas te rtog pa dang sel ba med cing btang snyoms par kun tu snang la /
translated: The practice of the branch of enlightenment of meditative absorption is the purity of engaging in all worldly activities while remaining in a state of one-pointed equipoise.

original: sems can la yang lta ba 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la yang lta ba 'di ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The practice of the branch of enlightenment of equanimity is the purity of remaining in a state of non-duality, without conceptualization or reification, and yet still perceiving all things with equanimity.

original: rigs kyi bu /üîΩgzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gang chos thams cad khong du chud par byed pa dang / rjes su rtog par byed pa dang / rab tu 'byed par byed pa dang / 'jal bar byed pa dang / nye bar rtog pa khong du chud cing sems can gyi spyod pa mtho ba dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gang chos thams cad khong du chud par byed pa dang / rjes su rtog par byed pa dang / rab tu 'byed par byed pa dang / 'jal bar byed pa dang / nye bar rtog pa khong du chud cing sems can gyi spyod pa mtho ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: dma' ba thams cad rtogs te /
analyzed: dma' ba thams cad rtogs te /
translated: furthermore, when bodhisattvas comprehend, conceive, discern, measure, and understand all phenomena, they will understand the higher and lower states of beings.

original: de la gnas nas kyang ngan song du 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bag la nyal ba dang kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de la gnas nas kyang ngan song du 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bag la nyal ba dang kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba 'di dag ni /
translated: Abiding in that, they cultivate the path that leads to the lower realms.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: these are called the factors of awakening of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: This is the domain of the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: not of the ignoble.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi @391a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi @391a *//
translated: The domain of the noble ones

original: spyod yul gang yin pa de ni bdud sdig can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul gang yin pa de ni bdud sdig can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: is not the domain of the evil MƒÅra.üîΩThe domain of the noble ones

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: is not the domain of the proud.üîΩThe domain of the noble ones

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: is not the domain of all adversaries.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma la dmigs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of those who focus on characteristics.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or any phenomena.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni tshor ba yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni tshor ba yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of those who cling to any feelings.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of mind, thought, or consciousness.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of phenomena that are seen, heard, distinguished, or cognized.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni tha na mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa de ni tha na mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin te /
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not even the domain of those who attend to the idea of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: chos thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of any phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul @391b lo; ;chos thams cad kun nas mi ldang ba'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul @391b lo; ;chos thams cad kun nas mi ldang ba'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is not the domain of any conceptualization, thought, or imagination regarding any phenomena. The domain of the noble ones is the domain of the non-arising of any phenomena.

original: chos thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //üîΩchos thams cad rtsod pa med pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo // chos thams cad rtsod pa med pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is the domain of the incompatibility of any phenomena.üîΩThe domain of the noble ones is the domain of the non-disputation of any phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul ni 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of the noble ones is the domain of the signlessness of any phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: de ltar gang 'phags pa'i spyod yul yongs su dag pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de ltar gang 'phags pa'i spyod yul yongs su dag pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: Such is the bodhisattva's pure practice of the branches of enlightenment, which is the domain of the noble ones.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, what is the bodhisattva's pure practice of the path?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol pa dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes smos pa de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes smos pa de la yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: As for right view, what is right view?

original: gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the right view that all phenomena are the same.üîΩ

original: de bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not arouse the view of a self, the view of a sentient being, the view of a life-force, the view of a person, or the view of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //üîΩde chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / stong pa @392a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so // de chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / stong pa @392a *//
translated: Why is that? The view of a self, the view of a sentient being, the view of a life-force, the view of a person, and the view of emptiness are the same.

original: nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not arouse the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, or the view of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
translated: The view of annihilation, the view of permanence, and the view of emptiness are the same.

original: de 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not arouse the view of origination, the view of destruction, or the view of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so; ;de 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / ngar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nga yir 'dzin par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so; ;de 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / ngar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nga yir 'dzin par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: The view of the transitory collection, the view of grasping an ‚ÄòI‚Äô, the view of grasping ‚Äòmine‚Äô, and the view of emptiness do not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / ngar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nga yir 'dzin par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / ngar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nga yir 'dzin par lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
translated: The view of the transitory collection, the view of grasping an ‚ÄòI‚Äô, the view of grasping ‚Äòmine‚Äô, and the view of emptiness are the same.

original: de sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba yang ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: The view of the Buddha, the view of the Dharma, the view of the Sa·πÖgha, and the view of emptiness do not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni mtshungs so //
translated: The view of the Buddha, the view of the Dharma, the view of the Sa·πÖgha, and the view of emptiness are the same.

original: rigs kyi bu; de ltar na lta ba'i dmigs pa ni ji tsam du chung na mya ngan las 'das pa la lta ba'i dmigs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de ltar na lta ba'i dmigs pa ni ji tsam du chung na mya ngan las 'das pa la lta ba'i dmigs pa yang rung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, in this way, whatever the object of view, even if it is the object of view of nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: de tsam du yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam du yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not the correct view.

original: gang tha ma dang / rab dang / 'bring gi lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang tha ma dang / rab dang / 'bring gi lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The correct view is free from all views, whether inferior, middling, or superior.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de mnyam par lta'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar de mnyam par lta'i /
translated: Because it is an equal view.

original: mi mnyam par ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam par ma yin no //
translated: It is not an unequal view.

original: ji ltar na mnyam @392b par lta'i /
analyzed: ji ltar na mnyam @392b par lta'i /
translated: How is it an equal view?

original: mi mnyam par ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi mnyam par ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not an unequal view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni dman pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni dman pa /
translated: If one thinks that the qualities of ordinary beings are inferior

original: slob pa'i chos rnams ni dam pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams ni dam pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: and the qualities of those in training are superior, that is an unequal view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
translated: If one thinks that the qualities of ordinary beings are contaminated

original: mi slob pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: and the qualities of those beyond training are uncontaminated, that is an unequal view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni zang zing dang bcas pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni zang zing dang bcas pa /
translated: The qualities of ordinary people are with defilements,üîΩand the qualities of the Solitary Buddhas are without defilements.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni zang zing med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni zang zing med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: If one sees in this way, it is an uneven view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The qualities of ordinary people are with defilements,üîΩand the qualities of the Bodhisattvas are without defilements.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: If one sees in this way, it is an uneven view.

original: so so'i skye ba'i chos rnams ni 'dus byas yin la /
analyzed: so so'i skye ba'i chos rnams ni 'dus byas yin la /
translated: The qualities of ordinary people are conditioned,üîΩand the qualities of the Buddhas are unconditioned.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni 'dus ma byas yin no snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni 'dus ma byas yin no snyam du gal te de ltar lta na mi mnyam par lta ba'o //
translated: If one sees in this way, it is an uneven view.

original: nam so so'i skye bo'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad slob pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: nam so so'i skye bo'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad slob pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du mthong ste /
translated: When one sees that the nature of all qualities of ordinary people is the essence of the qualities of the learners,

original: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: such a view is called the right view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos stong pa nyid dang / mi slob pa'i chos stong pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos stong pa nyid dang / mi slob pa'i chos stong pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: They see the emptiness of the qualities of ordinary beings and the emptiness of the qualities of those beyond training as the same.

original: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Seeing in this way is called right view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos kyi rkyen mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rkyen mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos kyi rkyen mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rkyen mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: They see the condition of the qualities of ordinary beings and the condition of the qualities of solitary buddhas as the same.

original: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩso so'i skye bo'i chos dben pa dang / byang @393a *//
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o // so so'i skye bo'i chos dben pa dang / byang @393a *//
translated: Seeing in this way is called right view.

original: chub sems dpa'i chos dben pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i chos dben pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: They see the qualities of ordinary beings and the qualities of bodhisattvas as the same.

original: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Seeing in this way is called right view.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos yongs su grub pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su grub pa med pa mnyam pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos yongs su grub pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su grub pa med pa mnyam pa nyid mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: They see the qualities of ordinary beings and the qualities of buddhas as the same.

original: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a view is called the right view.

original: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de'i phyir yang gnyis la blo mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de'i phyir yang gnyis la blo mi 'jug ste /
translated: Because one sees equally, the mind does not engage in duality.

original: gang gnyis su med par mthong ba de yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gnyis su med par mthong ba de yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing nonduality is seeing reality.

original: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de yang tha dad du mi byed do //
analyzed: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de yang tha dad du mi byed do //
translated: Because one sees equally, one does not make distinctions.üîΩSeeing nondistinction is seeing reality.

original: tha dad med pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o; ;gang mtshungs par mthong ba de tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi chos la rnam par rtog pa mi skyed de /
analyzed: tha dad med pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o; ;gang mtshungs par mthong ba de tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi chos la rnam par rtog pa mi skyed de /
translated: Because one sees equally, one does not generate concepts about phenomena, whether inferior, middling, or superior.

original: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med par mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med par mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing all phenomena without conceptualization is seeing reality.

original: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de ni mthong ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de ni mthong ba ci yang med do //
translated: Because one sees equally, one does not see anything at all.

original: mthong ba ci yang med pa ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ci yang med pa ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing anything is seeing reality.

original: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de ni chos gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mtshungs par mthong ba de ni chos gang yang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because one sees equally, no phenomena appear at all.

original: chos thams cad snang ba med par mthong ba de ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad snang ba med par mthong ba de ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing all phenomena as non-appearing is seeing reality.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang chos 'di dag de ltar mthong ba 'di ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang chos 'di dag de ltar mthong ba 'di ni yang dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: seeing these phenomena in this way is seeing reality.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Seeing things as they are and seeing them as equal is called right view in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong lnga brgya ni @393b len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba bstan pa 'di bshad pa na dge slong lnga brgya ni @393b len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this teaching on right view was explained, the minds of five hundred monks were liberated from defilements with no further grasping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po zhig ni mnyam pa nyid kyi chos nyid la bzod pa skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag mang po zhig ni mnyam pa nyid kyi chos nyid la bzod pa skyes so //
translated: Many thousands of bodhisattvas gave rise to acceptance of phenomena as they are.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô right thought?

original: rtog pa gang rtag pa spong par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gang rtag pa spong par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the thought that leads to the abandonment of permanence.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: zhi gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa ste /
translated: and skill in the insight that is included in serenity.

original: de chos gang zhig chos gang dang ldan snyam du chos de dag la rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: de chos gang zhig chos gang dang ldan snyam du chos de dag la rnam par lta'o //
translated: He observes those phenomena, thinking, ‚ÄòWhat phenomena are associated with what phenomena?‚Äô

original: rnam par rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par rtog go /
translated: He conceptualizes them.

original: de chos thams cad phan tshun mi ldan pa dang / rab tu ldan pa ma yin pa dang; ma 'dres par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de chos thams cad phan tshun mi ldan pa dang / rab tu ldan pa ma yin pa dang; ma 'dres par rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows that all phenomena are mutually unassociated, unassociated with each other, and unmixed.

original: des de ltar shes nas mnyam par yang mi rtog na gang mi mnyam par rtog par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: des de ltar shes nas mnyam par yang mi rtog na gang mi mnyam par rtog par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: Having known that, he does not even conceptualize them as equal, let alone conceptualize them as unequal.

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de chos su rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: de chos su rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: He abandons all conceptualization, conceptual thoughts, and conceptual notions about phenomena.

original: phyir yang mi rtog /
analyzed: phyir yang mi rtog /
translated: He does not conceptualize them again.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This non-conceptualization is called right conceptualization.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ngag gang zhe na /
translated: what is a bodhisattva‚Äôs right speech?

original: tshig gang gis bdag la yang mi gdung la /
analyzed: tshig gang gis bdag la yang mi gdung la /
translated: Words that do not torment oneself

original: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed la /
translated: It does not harm others.üîΩIt does not harm oneself.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang mi gnod la /üîΩgzhan la yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin pa dang / bdag la yang mi gnod la / gzhan la yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It does not harm others.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called right speech.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ni tshig gis chos thams cad mnyam ba @394a *//üîΩnyid du nges par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ni tshig gis chos thams cad mnyam ba @394a *// nyid du nges par rtog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, right speech is the verbal ascertainment of the equality of all phenomena.

original: de'i chos nges par rtog pa de yang chos nges pa'i tshig des 'byung ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i chos nges par rtog pa de yang chos nges pa'i tshig des 'byung ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: That ascertainment of the Dharma through that verbal ascertainment of the Dharma is called right speech.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ni gang mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba rnams la ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ni gang mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba rnams la ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, right speech is the same speech toward friends and foes, the same speech about the emptiness of all phenomena, the same speech about the signlessness, wishlessness, and non-application of all phenomena, the same speech about the non-arising, non-birth, non-production, and non-existence of all phenomena, the same speech about the non-existence of sentient beings, the same speech about the non-existence of life-force, the same speech about the non-existence of individuals, the same speech about the non-existence of persons, the same speech about the non-existence of masters, the same speech about the non-existence of owners, the same speech about the non-existence of doers, the same speech about the non-existence of knowers, the same speech about the non-existence of seers, the same speech about the non-existence of hearers, the same speech about the non-existence of thinkers, the same speech about the non-existence of experiencers, the same speech about the non-existence of feelers, the same speech about the non-existence of perceivers, the same speech about the non-existence of observers, the same speech about the non-existence of the past, the same speech about the non-existence of the future, the same speech about the non-existence of the present, the same speech about the non-existence of the three times, the same speech about the non-existence of the world, the same speech about the non-existence of the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond, the same speech about the non-existence of the world and the world beyond

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The same statement is made in the sutra: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The same statement is made in the sutra: All conditioned things are suffering.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: The same statement is made in the sutra: All dharmas are without self.üîΩ The same statement is made in the sutra: Nirvana is peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag dang bral ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag dang bral ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang /
translated: The same statement is made in the sutra: All dharmas are without self, without sentient being, without life, without person, and without individual.üîΩ The same statement is made in the sutra: All dharmas are dependently arisen and without intrinsic nature.

original: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / rgyu ci 'dra ba 'bras bu yang de 'dra ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes ngag mnyam pa dang / rgyu ci 'dra ba 'bras bu yang de 'dra ba'o zhes ngag mnyam pa'o //
translated: The same statement is made in the sutra: The effect is similar to the cause.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya ba ni gang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag yang dag pa'i chos la 'dzud pa dang / byang chub kyang yang dag par rab tu 'dzin du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya ba ni gang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag yang dag pa'i chos la 'dzud pa dang / byang chub kyang yang dag par rab tu 'dzin du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, right speech is that which introduces other sentient beings, other individuals, to the true Dharma, and which causes them to take up and hold to enlightenment.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called right speech.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right speech that is completely purified?

original: @394b ngag thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: @394b ngag thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: All speech is taken hold of by the Buddha.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas‚Äô right speech that is completely purified.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô right action?

original: las gang las zad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: las gang las zad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is action that exhausts karma,

original: las mngon par 'du bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / las gang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / las gang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: but not for the sake of accumulating karma. It is action that pacifies the afflictions,üîΩbut not for the sake of accumulating the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa 'bar ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / las gang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'bar ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / las gang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is not for the sake of inflaming the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not for the sake of generating the afflictions, but for the sake of being free from the afflictions.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: This is right action.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni gang chos 'di dag 'di ltar rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni gang chos 'di dag 'di ltar rab tu shes shing /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, noble sir, a bodhisattva‚Äôs right action is that, knowing these things in this way,

original: dge bas mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed kyang de mngon par 'du bya ba de dag kyang gsob nyid du snang ba dang / gsog nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid du snang ba ste /üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: dge bas mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed kyang de mngon par 'du bya ba de dag kyang gsob nyid du snang ba dang / gsog nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid du snang ba ste / rigs kyi bu /
translated: he performs all wholesome actions, but he sees those actions as hollow, false, insubstantial, and empty.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi rnam pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //üîΩrigs kyi bu /

translated: ‚ÄúNoble sir, this is the right action of bodhisattvas, accomplished by means of the knowledge of the aspects of enlightenment.üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, noble sir, a bodhisattva‚Äôs right action is that, knowing these things in this way,üîΩhe performs all wholesome actions, but he sees those actions as hollow, false, insubstantial, and empty.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //

translated: what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô correct effort?

analyzed: gang dge zhing zab pa'i chos de dag la yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir sems yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson pa dang / spro ba dang / rtsom pa dang / mi zhum pa dang / yang dag pa'i nan tan gyis mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: It is the correct and thorough application of the mind, the will, the diligence, the enthusiasm, the undertaking, the indefatigability, and the correct practice in order to accomplish the virtuous and profound Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

translated: furthermore, a bodhisattva‚Äôs right mindfulness is the right mindfulness that does not give rise to any opportunity for the afflictions, the mindfulness that does not give rise to any opportunity for the works of MƒÅra, and the mindfulness that does not give rise to any opportunity for straying onto the wrong path,

translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattva is the correct observation of the forms, colors, signs, and shapes that appear in the ten directions.

translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattva is the attainment of one‚Äôs own splendor, which is the characteristic of non-conditioning, and which is the attainment of the head of all gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: de pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa yin te /

translated: It is the knowledge of the mind that arose in the past of all sentient beings, gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and beings of the world of Yama.

original: phyi ma'i mthar sems skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang rab tu @397b shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na sems skye ba gang yin pa de yang rab tu shes pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dang / dmigs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar sems skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang rab tu @397b shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na sems skye ba gang yin pa de yang rab tu shes pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dang / dmigs par ldan pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the mind that will arise in the future. It is the knowledge of the mind that arises in the present. It is the knowledge of the mind with its causes, conditions, and objects.

original: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes pa dang / 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams dang /
analyzed: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes pa dang / 'dod chags la spyod pa rnams dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa rnams dang /
translated: the minds of beings who are certain, uncertain, or wrongly certain, and the minds of beings who are rightly certain.üîΩHe knows the minds of beings who are engaged in desire, anger,

original: gti mug la spyod pa rnams dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa rnams dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams rab tu shes te /
translated: ignorance, and the combination of these three.

original: shes nas kyang de kho na bzhin du de dang mthun par chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: shes nas kyang de kho na bzhin du de dang mthun par chos ston pa ste /
translated: Knowing this, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: rigs kyi bu; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Son of noble family, this is the bodhisattvas‚Äô fivefold pure experience of the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others.

original: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas have a fivefold pure experience of the superknowledge of recollecting previous states.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /

original: sems gang 'dod chags kyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / zhe sdang gi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / gti mug gi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de dag kyang rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sems gang 'dod chags kyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / zhe sdang gi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / gti mug gi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de dag kyang rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: It is the recollection of the mind that arises from the cause of desire, the mind that arises from the cause of anger, the mind that arises from the cause of delusion, and the body that is taken up by those.

original: sems gang sbyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / byams pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / snying rje'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: sems gang sbyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / byams pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / snying rje'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba rnams dang /
translated: It is the recollection of the mind that arises from the cause of generosity, the mind that arises from the cause of discipline, the mind that arises from the cause of love, the mind that arises from the cause of compassion, and the mind that arises from the cause of samƒÅdhi.

original: de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de @398a *//
analyzed: de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de @398a *//
translated: It is the recollection of the body that is taken up by those.

original: dag kyang rjes su dran pa dang / sems gang rgyu dang mi 'dra ba rnams dang / rkyen dang mi 'dra ba rnams dang / dmigs pa dang mi 'dra ba rnams dang / de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de dag kyang rjes su dran pa dang; sems gang lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang /

translated: the minds that are neutral,üîΩenveloped by ignorance and delusion, and the bodies that they have taken up;

analyzed: ma rig pa dang / gti mug gis yang dag par bsdus pa rnams dang / de dag gis lus ci 'dra ba yongs su bzung ba de dag kyang rjes su dran pa dang / de dag gi tshe dang / kha dog dang / gzugs dang /

analyzed: gzi brjid dang / g-yog dang / stobs dang / grags pa dang / brjod pa dang / dbang phyug ci 'dra bar gyur pa de yang rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: radiance, retinues, strengths, fame, reputations, and powers;

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas‚Äô pure activity of the superknowledge that is the recollection of previous lives, in five aspects.

analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa yin te /

analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They areüîΩthe miracle of displaying bodies and forms,üîΩthe miracle of making known words and sounds,üîΩthe miracle of mental activity and intention,

original: lus dang gzugs kun du ston pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / tshig dang skad rnam par rig par byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / sems dang yid mngon par 'du byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / sems can thams cad kyi skad du rnam par rig par byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs @398b su dag pa rnam pa 'di lnga dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They have these five pure activities of the superknowledge that is the performance of miracles.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva‚Äôs fivefold pure practice of the superknowledge of miraculous abilities.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son,

analyzed: rnam par shes pa rab tu gnas pa ni lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o // rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag par rab tu gnas pa ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o; ;sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su gcod par rab tu gnas pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i
translated: The practice of the superknowledge of the divine ear is the pure practice of the divine ear that is well established in consciousness.üîΩThe practice of the superknowledge of the knowledge of others‚Äô minds is the pure practice of the knowledge of others‚Äô minds that is well established in natural purity.

original: mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The practice of the superknowledge of the recollection of former lives is the pure practice of the recollection of former lives that is well established in the discernment of the past and the future.

analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed par rab tu gnas pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams zhes bya ba de ni zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dvags so //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni mngon par shes pa lnga po 'di dag gis rnam par rtsen cing zag pa zad pa'i ye shes la'ang gnas so //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: grong khyer chen po de'i lam ni bgrod par dka' zhing ring la / nyam nga @399a *//

analyzed: gang grong khyer chen po der phyin pa de'i sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur ba zhig yod pa dang / de nas skyes bu la la zhig gis grong khyer chen po de'i yang dag pa'i yon tan dang bsngags pa thos nas skyes bu de la bu mthong na dga' ba /
translated: Then, some person hears the true qualities and praises of that great city and tells that person, ‚ÄòYou have a son who is dear,

analyzed: phyir phyogs nas bu gcig pa de ga la 'dug par slar log pa de bzhin du /

translated: Having generated the mind of great compassion, he has cultivated the wisdom of the destruction of the contaminants in order to protect all sentient beings. But because of his regard for sentient beings, he turns away from that and

original: rigs kyi bu /

translated: This is how the bodhisattvas‚Äô love for all sentient beings is like that for an only son.üîΩAlthough he has reached the peak of the exhaustion of defilements,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod rnam grangs 'dis kyang ji ltar bag yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi snying po mdzes par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub kyang bag yod pas thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Noble sir, by this one of many explanations, you should understand how the enlightenment of the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones is beautified by the bodhisattvas who are heedful, and how the enlightenment of the Tathagatas is attained by heedfulness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas‚Äô conduct that purifies the ripening of beings?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can gyi spyod pa tshad med mtha' yas bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa tshad med mtha' yas bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: the conduct of beings is immeasurable, limitless, and inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yang tshad med mtha' yas bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa yang tshad med mtha' yas bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattvas‚Äô conduct that ripens beings is also immeasurable, limitless, and inconceivable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed nus so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed nus so //
translated: When bodhisattvas know the thoughts of beings, they are able to ripen beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /üîΩde ltar sems can la la ni tshul @406a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / de ltar sems can la la ni tshul @406a *//
translated: Son of noble family,

original: khrims kyis yongs su smin par 'gyur /
analyzed: khrims kyis yongs su smin par 'gyur /
translated: some beings are ripened through discipline,

original: la la ni tshul khrims spangs pas /
analyzed: la la ni tshul khrims spangs pas /
translated: some through abandoning discipline,

original: sems can la la ni tshig gis shin tu gdams pas yongs su smin par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can la la ni tshig gis shin tu gdams pas yongs su smin par 'gyur /
translated: some beings are ripened through being instructed with words,

original: la la ni 'jam pos /
analyzed: la la ni 'jam pos /
translated: some through gentleness,

original: la la ni tshig rtsub pos /
analyzed: la la ni tshig rtsub pos /
translated: some through harsh words,

original: la la ni de gnyis kas /
analyzed: la la ni de gnyis kas /
translated: Some are through both of these.

original: la la ni 'jigs par byas pas /
analyzed: la la ni 'jigs par byas pas /
translated: Some are through being frightened.

original: la la ni 'jigs pa las yongs su thar par byas pas /üîΩla la ni bslangs pas /
analyzed: la la ni 'jigs pa las yongs su thar par byas pas / la la ni bslangs pas /
translated: Some are through being freed from fear.üîΩSome are through being asked.

original: la la ni ma bslangs pas /
analyzed: la la ni ma bslangs pas /
translated: Some are through not being asked.

original: la la ni gnod pas /
analyzed: la la ni gnod pas /
translated: Some are through being harmed.

original: la la ni mi gnod pas /üîΩla la ni zil gyis mnon pas /
analyzed: la la ni mi gnod pas / la la ni zil gyis mnon pas /
translated: Some are through not being harmed.üîΩSome are through being overwhelmed.

original: la la ni zil gyis ma mnan pas /
analyzed: la la ni zil gyis ma mnan pas /
translated: Some are through not being overwhelmed.

original: la la ni sbyangs pas /
analyzed: la la ni sbyangs pas /
translated: Some are through being trained.

original: la la ni ma sbyangs pas //
analyzed: la la ni ma sbyangs pas //
translated: Some are through not being trained.

original: la la ni tshar bcad pas /
analyzed: la la ni tshar bcad pas /
translated: Some are through being defeated.

original: la la ni sbyin pa'i phyir byin pas /
analyzed: la la ni sbyin pa'i phyir byin pas /
translated: Some are through giving for the sake of giving.

original: la la ni bslangs pas /
analyzed: la la ni bslangs pas /
translated: Some are through being asked.

original: sems can la la ni gzugs yid du 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni gzugs yid du 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings are brought to full maturity through the establishment of pleasant forms.

original: sems can la la ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos yid du 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos yid du 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings are brought to full maturity through the establishment of pleasant sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental objects.

original: sems can la la ni gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings are brought to full maturity through the establishment of unpleasant forms.

original: sems can la la ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos yid du mi 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos yid du mi 'ong ba nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by unpleasant sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental objects.

original: sems can la la ni spyod pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni spyod pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by their conduct.

original: sems can la la ni rtag tu mthong bas /
analyzed: sems can la la ni rtag tu mthong bas /
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by always seeing the TathƒÅgata.

original: la la ni ma mthong bas /
analyzed: la la ni ma mthong bas /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by never seeing the TathƒÅgata.

original: sems @406b can la la ni sangs rgyas kyi sgras /üîΩsems can la la ni chos kyi sgras /
analyzed: sems @406b can la la ni sangs rgyas kyi sgras / sems can la la ni chos kyi sgras /
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by the sound of the Buddha.üîΩSome are brought to maturity by the sound of the Dharma.

original: sems can la la ni dge 'dun gyi sgras /
analyzed: sems can la la ni dge 'dun gyi sgras /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: la la ni mi rtag pa'i sgras /
analyzed: la la ni mi rtag pa'i sgras /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of impermanence.

original: la la ni sdug bsngal gyi sgras /
analyzed: la la ni sdug bsngal gyi sgras /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of suffering.

original: la la ni bdag med pa'i sgras /
analyzed: la la ni bdag med pa'i sgras /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of no-self.

original: la la ni zhi ba'i sgras /
analyzed: la la ni zhi ba'i sgras /
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of peace.

original: sems can la la ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by the sound of generosity, moral discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative stability, and wisdom.

original: sems can la la ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can la la ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by the sound of the sufferings of the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama.

original: la la ni lha'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni lha'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i sgras yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of the happiness of the gods.

original: sems can la la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gtam gyis /
analyzed: sems can la la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i gtam gyis /
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by the sound of the vehicle of the disciples.üîΩSome are brought to maturity by the sound of the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: la la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam gyis; la la ni theg pa chen po'i gtam gyis yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam gyis; la la ni theg pa chen po'i gtam gyis yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are brought to maturity by the sound of the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can la la ni sbyin pas yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems can la la ni sbyin pas yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by generosity,

original: snyan par smra bas ma yin /
analyzed: snyan par smra bas ma yin /
translated: but not by pleasant speech,

original: don spyod pas ma yin /
analyzed: don spyod pas ma yin /

original: don mthun pas ma yin /
analyzed: don mthun pas ma yin /

original: sems can la la ni snyan par smra bas yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems can la la ni snyan par smra bas yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Some beings are brought to maturity by pleasant speech,

analyzed: sbyin pas ma yin /
